At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks Technologists work to achieve this mission using cutting-edge technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities. This job contributes to Starbucks success by delivering high-quality, reliable, and stable technologies in support of the Starbucks Global Technology Platform. This position is accountable for problem identification and analysis, problem resolution, and system lifecycle management. In addition to providing second level support of a continuously operational production environment, the technologist in this role will create and implement automation to perform operations tasks, and to prevent and respond to incidents across teams. An effective DevOps Engineer II will develop and share subject matter expertise and gain experience by partnering across teams. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles Summary Of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following Technical Design and Implementation In conjunction with the application development team, develops software tools to solve technology operations problems. Ensures solutions are secure, durable, scalable, flexible, and accessible. Proactively mitigates against production support issues. Proposes opportunities for automation to prevent and respond to incidents, to improve security, to improve data integrity, and to help application owners successfully manage their environments. Participates in planning, decomposing, estimating, scheduling, prioritization and resource allocation exercises. Assists in prototypes for complex problems as appropriate, earning to build incrementally, with an eye toward vision of the final product. Provides transparency in approach and progress, throughout the process. Engages in the solution design process. Participates in requirements gathering and backlog refinement, assists with systems approach, helps with project initiation, contributes to functional design, and delivers technical design and development. Automates test coverage per platform capabilities and requirements. Assists with manual system and integration testing efforts. Contributes to the deployment approach, including planning and execution, data conversion approach, script development and execution, warranty period and transition of the solution to the platform's operational context. Learns to operate effectively in the Agile Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) processes and methodologies. Production Support Diagnoses, troubleshoots, and remediates incidents and problems to support the tools created and owned by the operations team. Participates in root cause analysis efforts to identify and implement solutions to operational issues. Maintains and reports operational Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) on items such as performance, service incidents and tickets set forth by the organization leadership. Creates and maintains documentation supporting training, system administration, deployment, and operational processes and procedures. Participates in on-call rotation for 24x7 environment. Provides system support for escalated issues, working trouble tickets according to priority, completing resolution within SLA. Assists in incident resolution for issue remediation Investigates and provides root cause analysis for incidents Fulfills service requests and writes applications or scripts automating the fulfillment of service requests Engages with vendors in support of incidents as needed Identifies operating system problems, takes corrective action, and refers problems or issues to third- level support groups as required; uses established escalation procedures. Documents problems in the problem management system, extracts statistics on errors or problems, and prepares reports on trends. Represents department as a participant in application development, change management, production readiness reviews and other special projects as required. Platform Stewardship Participates in the Platform Stewardship portfolio. Contributes to the vision, roadmap, and platform investments needed to take our business solutions to the next level. Helps to identify, influence, sell and prioritize innovative platform opportunities, as well as technical debt. Partners with cross functional teams, such as Infrastructure, Security, Architecture, QA and key Development teams, to strengthen and elevate the platform from a technology perspective. Successfully contributes to designs and solutions through enterprise processes and governance to ensure compliant, secure and supportable solutions. Contributes to the platform development community by providing input, content and feedback on design patterns, coding standards, and shared libraries. Leadership Initiates and facilitates team meetings to socialize technical ideas, encourages a culture of technical excellence among peers, and identifies good opportunities for adopting innovation. Shares knowledge freely, assisting teammates in learning coding, systems engineering, etc., helping to raise the overall skill level of the team Receptive and responsive to coaching and guidance from leaders and more experienced application development engineers from other teams. Seeks input and support as required. Works in an increasingly self-directed manner. Provides constructive input and perspective to team conversations. Consults in the IT planning process by providing application and platform expertise for new business capabilities under consideration. System Admin Specific Competencies for Role Install, configure, test and maintain operating systems, application software and system management tools Monitor and test application performance for potential bottlenecks, identify possible solutions, and assist application owners with implementing fixes Tier 1 and Tier 2 management and monitoring all installed systems and infrastructure pertinent to specified role (e.g., Physical Server, Virtual Servers, Storage, Firmware, Pre-Engineered Systems, OS, Monitoring/App Performance Software, Desktop Hardware/OS, general end user infrastructure front line support) Use console management, incident management, and job scheduler software applications. Basic Qualifications 2-4 years of professional industry experience with software development 2+ years’ experience with systems administration across both Linux (or other Unix OS) and Windows Servers Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or relevant addttional industry experience 2+ years’ experience supporting servers on both physical hardware and VMware Ability to be on-call periodically Preferred Qualifications Experience creating and updating Slack apps / bots Experience with Python or similar language Experience with Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) Knowledge of or experience with artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) and especially AI Ops Knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and computer science concepts relative to the platform. Proficiency in development languages, tools, frameworks, utilities, and technical dependencies. Ability to write and value high quality, reusable software with minimal defects. Ability to learn and incorporate new technologies, concepts, and development languages. Ability to absorb new concepts and technical implementation of application architecture, infrastructure, and security. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines Ability to use business knowledge, sound judgment, and resourcefulness to proactively move efforts forward All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that

jobTitle: director, Global Coffee Alliance, North America CPG
jobDescription: Now Brewing – Brand and Business Development Leaders! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. The Starbucks Global Channel Development brand management team leads marketing, innovation, and digital experiences on Starbucks products delivered in channels outside of our retail cafes. We do this through thoughtful partnerships with some of the world’s leading food and beverage companies. At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup and one neighborhood at a time. We are in an exciting position to further expand how we deliver on that mission through our partnership with Nestle. The Director of Global Coffee Alliance (GCA), North America CPG will be a key leader on the Global Channel Development team at Starbucks, working to build a world-class partnership with Nestle, and expanding the Starbucks brand and business across North America. The Director of GCA, North America CPG will work in partnership with Nestle’s teams on at-home coffee products in the US and Canada, as well as Starbucks coffee creamers, to develop category leading innovation, brand accretive marketing creative, digital customer experiences, and strategic growth initiatives that drive the business, and expand the Starbucks brand. This leader must be able to influence with impact, both within Starbucks, and with leadership at Nestle. A proven track record of developing strong relationships, driving results, and excellent communication skills are paramount to success. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Leadership Sets an example for all of channel development, on how to build strong and successful partnerships, and builds this skill within their team Creates a culture of cross functional collaboration & innovative thinking within Starbucks, to drive enterprise level thinking and insights into our partnership Innovation Collaborates with Nestle to develop a best-in-class pipeline of innovation to drive growth across our at-home coffee and creamers businesses Works in partnership with Nestle on product positioning and packaging creative for innovation Marketing Works in partnership with Nestle on marketing plans and marketing creative, ensuring the Starbucks brand shows up consistently, and elevates all consumer touch points Partners with cross-functional teams within Starbucks, to ensure visibility and engagement in our marketing work on the GCA Leads strategic thinking on digital customer experiences including initiatives to increase personalization and loyalty and ensuring tie-back to Enterprise objectives Strategic Planning Leads annual strategic planning process, and annual plan process for GCA business in North America Identifies strategies and tactics to further develop our business, through a strong knowledge of the business/category, and through successfully gaining enterprise level perspective within Starbucks. Business Development Leads new business development conversations in partnership with Corp Development, Finance, Legal, and key cross functional partners internal and external Skilled negotiator who sees the whole, communicates with confidence/clarity, thrives in high stakes Partner Development & Team Building The Director of GCA will manage a team of 13 Starbucks partners, including core business, innovation, and digital customer experiences. It is critical this leader has a successful track record of coaching and developing partners, and in building strong teams. They will be responsible for leading and inspiring their partners, and the broader channel development organization, to build best in class talent for Starbucks. jobDescription: Now Brewing – Software Engineer II – MarTech! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. If you live in the greater Seattle area, we offer a flexible workplace that allows for hybrid work. Partners can work remotely up to four days per week and leverage the office 1-2 days per week, on average. This position contributes to Starbucks success by planning and execution of activities of a Platform Engineering Team with a strong focus on platform automation and security. As engineer lead in platform development and engineering, you are responsible for leading a team of software developers through planning, delivery, and operations of solutions. You are also responsible for the evolvement, delivery and support the technology strategy and roadmaps for new and existing applications and platforms. This role requires hands-on technical, domain proficiency, platform depth, and leadership. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Leadership – Setting goals for the work group, developing organizational capability, and modeling how we work together: Leads the technical team through the solution design process. Leverages and develops talent on the team through all phases of project efforts, including requirements gathering, assessment and backlog refinement. Shapes and guides systems approach, manages project initiation, technical design and development efforts. Ensures platform has appropriate design patterns and coding standards in place. Directs team toward secure, durable, scalable, flexible, and accessible solutions that proactively mitigate against production support issues. Accountable for delivery of development and operational efforts of the team by ensuring efforts are staffed, structured, budgeted and prioritized appropriately. Leads an engineering team with Platform Security Automation focus to comply with Starbucks Global Cyber Security requirements. Provide Security Architecture Design Pattern and engineering services for common platform components Provide consultative services to the application product teams. Interface with Starbucks Cloud and Global Cyber Security teams representing our platforms. Platform Stewardship – Championing platform efforts to promote platform evolvement and stability to support business needs. Partners with cross functional teams, such as Infrastructure, Security, Architecture, QA and key Development teams, to strengthen and elevate the platform from a technology perspective. Successfully sees designs and solutions through enterprise processes and governance to ensure compliant, secure and supportable solutions. Partner Development and Team Building – Providing partners with coaching, feedback, and developmental opportunities, and building effective teams: Provides partners with coaching, feedback and developmental opportunities and builds effective teams. Ensures partners adhere to legal and operational compliance requirements. Production Support for application and platform components Defines and maintains processes, procedures, and expectations for team’s production support responsibilities. Ensures platform application and platform support documentation is in place. Leads team through high severity security related operational incidents. Basic Qualifications 6+ years of professional industry experience with software development and operations 3-5 years of leading or managing systems or application development projects of all sizes and complexities, including large distributed systems 3-5 years of leading or managing small technical teams Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field Preferred Qualifications Technical Proficiency Ability to lead a team of technical experts that cohesively build and operate secure, durable, flexible, accessible solutions. Requires an understanding of relevant development languages, tools, frameworks, utilities and technical dependencies. Recognizes, values and champions high quality, reusable software with minimal defects on the team. Ability to build automation tools for security processes for various automation pipeline. Expert in understanding of implications tradeoffs from design and implementation architecture choices toward building secure, scalable, durable, flexible, accessible solutions. Familiarity and curiosity in the business context and trends, as well as the business customers’ opportunities. Awareness of the functional aspects of the solution. The Digital Stored Value Card engineering team is an exciting and fast evolving technology group within the Starbucks Engineering organization. The Card team mission is to optimize and deliver industry leading transactional processing and management to support Starbucks pre-paid card business. As a Lead Software Engineer, you will lead the architecture, design and development of highly performant, resilient, scalable, extensible, and available software. You will collaboratively lead, identify, design, develop and deploy technology and process solutions - enabling the delivery of business capabilities. This role requires wide and deep technical expertise and the ability to communicate direction and gain buy in from the team of engineers you work with. Typical activities include designing micro services, technical and functional requirements analysis, solution design, technical development, process improvement and production support. Our team embraces SOLID design principles and iterative value delivery – with emphasis on security, reliability, testability and quality. Services you work on will be consumed by mobile and web clients. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Works closely with the team to develop the best technical design and approach Drives approach, design patterns, and systems design for the complex and impactful solutions. Initiates process improvements for existing systems Leads and collaborates in planning, decomposing, estimating, scheduling, prioritization and resource allocation exercises for complex efforts. Takes the lead on prototype efforts for innovative problems. Builds incrementally, with an eye toward vision of the final product. Transparent in approach and progress, throughout the process. Works with the development team through the solution design process. Facilitates requirements gathering and backlog refinement, shapes and guides systems approach, contributes to functional design, and leads technical design and development. Takes responsibility of maintaining, troubleshooting existing on-premise systems. Drives the planned roadmap implementation with the team Troubleshooting production issues, on call issues and coming up with appropriate solution. Coaches and mentors application developers on the team in learning new skills and technologies. Works directly with the engineering manager to create and maintain operational Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) on items such as performance, service incidents and tickets set forth by the organization leadership. Identifies systemic problems that need holistic solutions and feedback into platform roadmap exercises. Qualifications 8+ years of professional industry experience with software development in C# 2+ years of leading team projects with four or more software developers Strong cloud experience with Azure Strong software engineering fundamentals including knowledge of design patterns and OO design principles. Experience in designing and developing a significant component or feature of a scalable service Experience working with distributed systems and architectures, including SOA, SaaS and microservices approaches Experience with architecture, design, implementation and delivery of high-volume transactional services that perform at scale Experience with relational and non-relational, NoSQL databases Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field Experience with Azure Service Bus and NServiceBus preferred #Transformation All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Now Brewing –engineer senior, martech! #tobeapartner At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks Technologists work to achieve this mission through the use of cutting-edge technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities. The Martech engineering team is looking for a senior software engineer to build applications our marketing teams use to complete their day-to-day work. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working anywhere in our technology stack, be that implementing JavaScript based UIs, backend APIs, databases, or infrastructure and monitoring. jobTitle: executive assistant sr to Chief Marketing Officer
jobDescription: Now Brewing – executive assistant sr to Chief Marketing Officer - #tobeapartner   From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. This job contributes to Starbucks success by providing advanced support of a highly confidential and complex nature to an executive vice president, exercising judgement and discretion in line with our mission and values. This role will plan, implement, and direct multiple concurrent activities that support company and business unit/department programs, processes and objectives. This role communicates with both internal partners, leaders and external customers, including high level executives. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. As an executive assistant to the Chief Marketing Officer, you will… Analyze business materials and company communications, leverage observations to inform decision making and executes tasks strategically to all stakeholders. Identify process improvement opportunities proactively and recommend solutions with confidence to promote operational efficiencies across the business unit Drive deadlines and deliverables while adapting to ambiguity, changing business needs or expectations; check in with support team to provide guidance and delegates as needed. Analyze incoming and outgoing business materials, company communication, and leverage observations to inform decision making and strategic execution of task to all stakeholders. Manage, adapt and adjust priorities proactively in an ever-changing work environment while maintaining professionalism under pressure. Manage long-term view of calendars strategically by collaborating across the enterprise to drive efficiency and understanding executives priorities. Utilize project management skills to drive high-level projects, events, and key business deliverables at an enterprise level; cascade pertinent information and communications to appropriate groups. Own and cascade rhythm of the business calendar to department support team and team members as appropriate; utilize this tool to drive successful execution of business priorities and deliverables. Ideate and implement programs for the leader and/or organization. Role-model and coach behaviors and practices that demonstrate what it means to live within our Starbucks Mission & Values. Build strong and trusting relationships across the enterprise and externally; creates opportunities across the enterprise for growth and connection. Lead admin team meetings and programs to create positive team environment that promotes inclusive and productive behaviors along with mentorship across the enterprise. Act as a trusted leader and mentor for admin team by regularly engaging and cascading information, actively participating in hiring, developing talent, and admin calibration sessions; while creating space for growth and development of others. We’d love to Hear From People With Progressive administrative experience. (8+ years) Providing support to C-Suite level executives (5+ years) Experience managing calendars and email on MS Outlook (7+ years) Project or event management (7+ years) Domestic and international travel arrangement (7+ years) Expert level proficiency with Microsoft 360 applications Adaptability - able to execute with flexibility in responding to constantly changing environment. Collaboration - demonstrate confidence, composure, and professionalism; able to build trust with internal and external customers. Communication - able to communicate clearly and concisely, both verbal and written with attention to details Customer Service - demonstrate a positive, can-do attitude with the desire to take on additional responsibilities, consistently delivers high quality customer service to both internal and external stakeholders Organization - excellent organizational skills and high level of integrity and discretion in handling confidential and sensitive information with superior attention to detail Problem Solving - critical thinking and strong analytical skills; able to proactively anticipate needs and use sound judgment. Technology - advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office 365 and virtual tools. Time Management - able to balance multiple priorities and projects in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines and follow through on commitments. Join us and be part of something bigger. Apply today! jobTitle: ios engineer I, Seattle OR Remote
jobDescription: The Starbucks iOS application is used by more than 25 million users every month and the iOS engineering team is growing and innovating quickly to deliver the best possible experience to our users. Come join the Starbucks iOS engineering team and help evolve mobile engineering at one of the world's most successful digital rewards and loyalty platforms. If you are driven by innovation, purpose-driven work, technical challenges and want to be a part of some amazing, industry-leading work come join us. As a member of the team, you will participate in assessing new projects and features for feasibility, write code for new features and important stability improvements. We are seeking someone that is team-oriented, has core iOS consumer-facing product engineering expertise and has a desire to grow into a leader on the mobile development team. Responsibilities Include Build, iterate, and enhance the Starbucks iOS application Partner closely with the design team and other cross-functional members of the team to co-create intuitive easy to use app experiences for our users and the business Contribute to the ongoing improvement of architecture and code reviews Optimize existing code for maintainability and testability Improve app quality with the development of unit and automated UI tests Support the effort to mature and evolve team testing practice and philosophy About You You approach challenges and problems with a positive solution-oriented mindset You can react swiftly to changing requirements and develop and explore alternative solutions You have a proven ability to learn new technologies relatively quickly and apply the gained knowledge to address customer and business problems You have a passion for iOS, and you are up to speed on the latest Swift and iOS trends and developments A strong passion for learning and adapting to new technologies Requirements And Qualifications Extensive software engineering experience with the iOS platform 2+ years of professional experience developing consumer-facing iOS mobile applications 2+ years of software development experience Exposure to integrating RESTful APIs, GraphQL, Core Location Services, Push Notifications Attention to detail, particularly around software engineering fundamentals, testing methodologies, and quality. Lead Enterprise Architect Location: Remote available; occasional travel Job Overview/ Description From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. We are seeking a Sustainability Technology Evangelist - a lead Enterprise Architect focusing on technology strategy and architecture to be part of Starbucks Coffee Company. This role will chart the course for the future of Starbucks and will be instrumental in showing the way to meet our critical corporate goals such as People Positive, Planet Positive, and Profit Positive. In this critical role, you will… Support Starbucks’ Planet positive goals around environment sustainability including Environment, Social and Governance (ESG), product sustainability, climate impact, ethical sourcing and more. This includes digital platform architecture and design encompassing multi business domains, spanning coffee farms, Global Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Retail Stores, Product and Data Lead cross functional teams in developing long-range technology architecture in anticipation of future business needs while maximizing investments Regularly advise senior leaders on strategic technology solutions within the largest Starbucks Technology portfolio, driving digital transformation through applications, data analytics, AI/ML, IoT, and other key enabling technologies An ideal person for this job… A dynamic Technology evangelist that has strong software design and platform architecture roots. Designs with digital-first mindset, past background designing large scale tech platforms A sustainability visionary with experience working in/with organizations like UN/ UNESCO/ Bill and Melinda Gates foundation/ other non-profits Master in driving hi-tech solutions addressing climate change, environmental and social responsibility organizations and has the ability to influence global executive leadership, as well as, leading ground-zero engineering teams. Has relentless pursuit of knowledge, excellence and exemplifies leadership in the Tech strategy space. Is comfortable with ambiguity and can lead through behavioral and structural transformation Has entrepreneurial mindset in innovating, finding breakthroughs and has a growth mindset Tool kits you’ll need to lead in this role… Strong story-telling ability and willingness to navigate cross functionally across a complex tech ecosystem Strong background in software engineering as well as ability to formulate big picture business strategy Has led teams across business domains and technology platforms to compose outcome-based solutions Build trust and relationships with multi-cultural and cross functional stakeholders People-first leadership style, strong executive communications, ability to thrive in a diverse global environment with high emotional intelligence Experience leading work in Environmental sustainability, Social responsibility and Climate sustainability If this sounds like you, we’d like to have coffee with you! Let’s immerse on a journey that shapes the future of coffee, transforming one person, one cup and one neighborhood at a time. Primary Responsibilities Own the technical relationship and discovery with cross-functional leaders to create product-centric solutions to advance the sustainability cause. Identify sustainability opportunities and product/platforms/solution intersections collaboratively with experts spanning the organization. Collaborate to formulate external partnerships and qualify proposals from a technical perspective. Understands disruptive forces and the business’s economic and financial levers that are susceptible to digital transformation to effectively guide technology investment decisions. Analyze enterprise business context (trends and business strategy), as well as change requirements in other enterprise architecture viewpoints, to derive the architecture future state. This includes defining the requirements, and models that guide technology decisions for the enterprise. Define high-level technology plans & capability roadmaps to address the gaps between the current and future state. Assist with designing the governance activities associated with ensuring architecture compliance. Define metrics to measure and demonstrate architecture solution value. Manage and continuously improve the design and implementation of Architecture processes and artifacts. Lead the development of an implementation plan for the enterprise architecture based on business requirements and the varying Tech strategies for project-driven or product-driven delivery teams. Education And Training And Experience Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis, or equivalent experience required; MBA from top tier business schools desired Minimum of 5 years of hands-on design and implementation of tech solutions Minimum of 5 years as an Enterprise Architect Should have exposure to scale in leading complex systems, technologies in a large enterprise Knowledge of all aspects of enterprise architecture Experience leading work in Environment, Social responsibility and Climate Sustainability required Required Knowledge And Skills Excellent interpersonal skills in areas such as teamwork, facilitation, and negotiation Strong written, verbal communication skills along with strong “story telling” and presentation skills Ability to understand the long-term ("big picture") and short-term perspectives of situations Ability to estimate the impact of individual solution architecture alternatives Ability to define multiple solution options to business problems Specialization in reporting, data analytics, and data architecture Basic knowledge of business process re-engineering principles and processes Understanding and use of Human Centered Design principles & methodologies Knowledge of business ecosystems, SaaS, infrastructure as a service (IaaS), platform as a service (PaaS), SOA, APIs, open data, microservices, event-driven IT and predictive analytics. Experience and certification in TOGAF or other architecture frameworks is preferred Familiarity with information management practices, system development life cycle management, IT services management, agile and lean methodologies, infrastructure and operations, and EA and ITIL frameworks. Extensive experience with more than one business domain like Supply Chain, Packaging, Finance, Customer & Retail, Store Development, etc., with Azure/ AWS/ GCP or other cloud technologies. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com.

One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. Millions of times a day customers interact with Starbucks payment systems across Retail and Digital platforms and customers expect to interact with those systems securely and seamlessly. Your role as Lead is to collaboratively lead and drive the overall data architecture supporting these areas and create Business Intelligence tools end to end that provide actionable insights that enable ongoing business optimization and sustainable growth. As a lead, Business Intelligence, you will… Be deeply embedded in the business where the output of your efforts will immediately improve business performance Build powerful self-serve tools to make it faster and easier for your internal customers to act on data and insights and easier on your teammates to find and fix problems quickly and efficiently Work with source technical teams to ensure data and reporting requirements are enabled within the source systems as required. We’d Love To Hear From People With 5+ years of experience with and detailed knowledge of data warehouse technical architectures, data modeling, infrastructure components, ETL/ ELT and reporting/analytic tools and environments, data structures and hands-on SQL coding. Proficiency in Microsoft BI platforms (SQL Server, Azure, Power BI, Analysis Services) Oracle PL/SQL experience a plus Strong data analytics skills with the ability to recognize if source data can satisfy customer measurement needs, and if not, work with source technology teams to implement solutions A strong grasp of SQL and at least one scripting or programming language. Experience with Databricks or other spark technologies Command knowledge of Agile methodology and tailoring designs and implementation to the maturity of the business A passion for learning and growing as technology continues to evolve An ownership mindset for the product vision, technical architecture, and project delivery Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Experience and passion working in a collaborative environment and implementing complex BI projects with multiple stakeholders and conflicting priorities Join us and be part of something bigger. jobTitle: Lead manager data science – People Analytics
jobDescription: Job Summary And Mission From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. As a lead manager data science, you will support our people analytics efforts at Starbucks, focused on strengthening the Starbucks partner experience. You will lead a small team of data scientists, decision scientists, and/or data analysts who leverage statistical analysis, data visualization, and storytelling to help us identify opportunities. Your team will support people analytics for retail, including labor relations, partner operations, and legal. You will build strong relationships with cross-functional business teams, collaborate closely with technology teams, and identify ways to improve existing processes or analytical approaches. You will coach and develop your team, helping them to drive impact while growing their careers at Starbucks. As a lead manager data science, you will… Serve as an embedded data science thought partner for business stakeholders, helping to define and shape business questions and translate them into actionable analytical questions Mentor or instruct more junior data scientists in best practices around the proper use of statistics and models to solve problems of interest Promote the value of data science (including AI and ML) to solve business problems & lead the strategy of new, creative data science solutions We’d Love To Hear From People With 5 years’ experience in data science MS with concentration in quantitative discipline Experience with people or operations analytics Experience building and leading teams Join us and be part of something bigger. Apply today! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. Now Brewing – Lead Manager Decision Science! #tobeapartner   From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing and supporting partners who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. “We built the Starbucks brand first with our people, not with consumers.  Because we believed the best way to meet and exceed the expectations of our customers was to hire and train great people, we invested in employees.” – Howard Schultz, CEO, Starbucks Coffee Company   The pay range for this position may be narrower than that displayed, depending on where the work is performed. As a Starbucks program manager, you will . . . Guide business decisions through discovering and sharing insights that deliver stakeholder outcomes and translate research into usable data products and sustainable solutions leveraged for proactive business application, embedding analytics as the face of the decision engine and connective tissue for Labor in Operations Services. Discovers, measures, and optimizes, bringing data-discovered challenges to the forefront to be powered by the right. You can apply research, statistics, experimental design, synthesize, analyze, implement, and deploy models, dashboards, and storytelling presentations that support Starbucks Global lines of business. You will mentor/instruct data analysts and decision scientists in best practice and privacy/security compliant data prep techniques. There needs to be focused attention on embedding analytics into business units and creating a data-driven strength that you evangelize organizationally. Models and acts per Starbucks' guiding principles. Leveraging Your Previous Experience, We Will Enable You To Models leadership behaviors that are grounded in Starbucks Mission and Values. Drives the engagement, development, and performance of all members of their team. Data Preparation: Execute extraction and synthesis of data extract data from various databases, including Azure: data lake storage, SQL server, and legacy systems: Oracle; perform exploratory data analysis, cleanse, massage, and aggregate data (high). Process 1st, 2nd, and 3rd party customer data in next-generation privacy-compliant infrastructure. Mentor/instruct data analysts and decision scientists in best practice and privacy/security compliant data prep techniques. Data Visualization: Work under consultative or self-initiated direction to assess and produce relevant, standard, or custom information (reports, charts, graphs, and tables) from structured data sources by querying data repositories and generating the associated information. Distribute and disseminate reports to applicable agencies, researchers, management, and other internal end-users. Skilled communication and data presentation and storytelling skills. Mentor/instruct decision scientists and data analysts in best practice and privacy/security in visualization techniques. Data manipulation and modeling: Ability to procure and manipulate large-scale, complex data from a variety of systems (AWS, Azure, Oracle, on-prem, web tool, etc.), experience reshaping data to ensure it is in the right structure for analysis, filtering and removal of outliers., Demonstrated experience with cloud tech for data and analytics solutions (Azure, AWS). Should be able to spot anomalies and data issues and work cross-functionally to resolve them. Manage the development of other decision scientists to profile unfamiliar data sources, and prepare steps for analysis. Data methodologies and analysis: Applicable business experience and the ability to handle and maintain the confidentiality of highly sensitive information required for statistical analysis and modeling techniques, including descriptive and predictive analysis (models, for example, regression, cluster, factor, survival, drivers, anomaly detection, etc. ), dashboard building, ability to determine the best methods would be to solve data problems, and skilled experience in Excel, SQL, SAS, R, Python, Tableau / PowerBI, and experimental design platforms. Skilled in using data methodologies and skills following business applicability and insights operationalization. Coaches team through code and methodology selection. Business Understanding: Thorough understanding of business jargon and key metrics. Works with business stakeholders to identify and clarify core problems and questions of interest. Leverages tactics like "five whys" to create the best and most optimal solutions. Mentor/instruct data analysts and decision scientists in best practices around understanding business asks deeply. Insights Operationalization: Effectively presents complex technical material to non-technical audiences in an approachable way. Provide analytic validation and application of data transformations, algorithms, etc.) to accurately represent the model and rule intent and promote recommendations into business processes. Drive analytics refresh exercise and rule tuning process as they pertain to KPIs. Instructs decision scientists and data analysts in best practices for insights operationalization into business. Leadership and Evangelism Outstanding collaboration skills with colleagues at all organizational levels; understands decision sciences and advanced analytics, and how to evangelize the craft to business partners and analytics peers. Multiply within the team the zeal and passion for the craft, compounded by the functional business actionability We’d Love To Hear From People With Education: BA/BS concentration preferred with discipline in Stats, Math, Comp Sci, Engineering, Econ, Psychology, Quantitative Social Science, or similar Ability to handle and maintain the confidentiality of highly sensitive information. Experience with Microsoft Office, including Excel and PowerPoint Strong Proficiency with SQL, SAS, Python, or R Skilled knowledge of statistics (descriptive, regression, etc.) Business experience with several data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) Retail, customer loyalty, or eCommerce experience preferred Years of experience in specific field or utilizing designated skills: Minimum 5 years’ Experience All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. jobTitle: lead UX designer, Starbucks Technology (Seattle, Chicago or Phoenix)
jobDescription: Come be part of an innovative team that believes in digging deeper to figure out how technology should work for our retail partners (employees). We’re looking for a user experience designer to join our team. Starbucks as a company is all about creating a culture of warmth and belonging, acting with courage, and delivering our very best. We are performance driven through the lens of humanity. When you work with us you hold Starbucks legacy. Our mission: Inspiring and nurturing the human spirit — one person, one cup, one neighborhood at a time. We are looking for someone who is not only passionate around design but embodies the Starbucks mission and values. Our User Experience team crafts delightful experiences that make store partners lives easier. We're a close-knit, collaborative group, guided by an iterative user-centered design process. Combining research, data, and thoughtful critique, we're discovering needs and solving fundamental problems that impact work and life for store partners across North America. In this role, you'll lead the experience strategy for an ecosystem of products that support our store partners and our growing business. You will do this by collaborating with designers, engineers, product, and operations managers across the company. jobTitle: Manager, Business Support and Operations team- Customer and Retail Technology
jobDescription: The Customer and Retail Technology (CRT) team is responsible for the product management, design, engineering and ongoing sustainment of all customer-facing digital products. This includes the Starbucks Rewards app, all digital consumer marketing platforms, the Point of Sale, and the various customer facing software and hardware solutions in our stores. Their Responsibilities Include The Program Management Office supporting the CRT team at Starbucks is looking for an experienced manager to lead our Business Support and Operations team. The right candidate for this role can effortlessly operate at both a strategic and a tactical level, partnering with Technology, Business, and Finance executives and stakeholders. Driving operational excellence and scale by establishing objectives and key results (OKRs) and leading transformation within the BSO, PMO and across CRT. Championing data best practices to increase data reliability, minimize manual processes, improve controls, and enable self-service BI reporting. Serve as the CRT liaison for the procure to pay process including processing contracts / POs and ensuring vendor invoices are being submitted on time, allocated to the correct budget, and paid in a timely fashion including accrual and reclass management. Partner with Finance to provide actionable insights, identify risks and opportunities, and promote effective annual planning, budgeting, and forecasting. Managing a team of employees and contractors that make up the BSO. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Participates in annual operational and financial planning and quarterly reforecasting efforts for the CRT portfolio of work Participate in Enterprise-wide budgeting processes in support of CRT. Including sustainment budget reforecasting, reconciliation processes with the Corporate Finance team, etc. Support the VPs and Directors in CRT with insights and reporting to help them make better business decisions. Builds and manages a high-performing team by making good hiring decisions, setting clear individual and team expectations, holding team members accountable to their commitments, fostering strong team collaboration, and supporting career growth. Responsible for setting goals for the work group, developing organizational capability, and modeling how we work together. This includes designing, planning and championing change management and improvement initiatives within the BSO, PMO and across CRT. Required Qualifications To Be Considered Minimum of two years’ experience as a manager of a finance or business operations team Minimum 4 years supporting financial planning and reforecasting processes Minimum 4. Now Brewing - manager, Loyalty Marketing Engagement! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. Our manager, Loyalty Marketing is responsible for driving Starbucks Rewards members through their loyalty lifecycle and will manage the strategy and implementation of delivering the right message, to the right customer, in the right channel, at the right time. This role will determine the right mix of communications, offers and experiences to reward members for their loyalty, deepen their engagement and ultimately, become advocates for the Starbucks brand and the Starbucks Rewards loyalty program. You will work cross-functionally to ensure clarity of offer and messaging for our members across communication channels and ensure proper implementation and measurement are in place. An understanding of customer lifetime value will be critical to maximizing the return on retention investment in our members. This role requires someone who leads with a customer-first approach and possesses excellent analytical and financial acumen, the ability to build and execute effective marketing strategies, and a keen understanding of how to leverage technology and digital capabilities to drive engagement and retention of Starbucks Rewards members. As an manager on the Loyalty Marketing team, you will… Develop, implement, and continually improve the impact of engagement, retention and advocacy campaigns based on customer insights, customer-level testing and quantitative analytics. Guide and collaborate with our internal and external agencies (Media, Creative, Marketing Operations) on the development of all marketing communications for engagement, retention and advocacy campaigns (from insights to brief to production to deployment). Champion an omnichannel mindset in implementation of marketing campaigns. Guide marketing channels on loyalty communication strategies to ensure that user experience needs for Starbucks Rewards members are integrated into owned, paid, and affiliate marketing channels. Partner with Analytics & Insights (A&I) and Finance teams to clearly measure, track, and report member behavior, engagement and retention at a member level and in aggregate. Continuously refine and optimize strategies through a test and learn approach. Maximize value among Starbucks Rewards members by understanding potential value, measuring channel tactic effectiveness and optimizing offers and communications. Partner with A&I to understand all available 1st and 3rd party customer insights to drive optimal targeting and relevant messaging. We’d Love To Hear From People With Bachelor’s Degree in Arts/Sciences (BA/BS) Business or Marketing required. 5+ years’ working in a fast-paced, high-volume consumer-facing corporate or agency environment with responsibility for loyalty strategy/marketing/planning or digital marketing with deep knowledge base of CRM/direct customer marketing programs across owned and paid channels, CRM/loyalty technology and platforms. Experience in multi-channel retail industry a plus. Strategic Thought Leadership - possesses business and strategic acumen with ability to communicate broader business vision to cross-functional and technical teams. Business Acumen – Strong financial acumen and ability to build business plans inclusive of financial performance levers. Agile decision-making, entrepreneurial nature, ability to formulate a strong POV and adjust plans strategically in a changing environment. Experience managing a P&L. Marketing Planning – able to develop a holistic and strategic marketing vision and strategy; lead a team in the planning, development, and execution of marketing campaigns. Customer-First Mindset - distill insights and drive relevant strategies that drive preference and loyalty for Starbucks. Experience leveraging customer segmentation and customer journeys to deliver relevant programs, benefits and experiences to drive business results. Analytical - synthesizes complex or diverse information; uses intuition and experience to complement data; ability to effectively communicate and translate business needs to technical teams (A&I, Starbucks Technology); proactively identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner. Leadership – demonstrated track record of leadership and ability to lead and influence cross functional teams; strong partnership skills with a history of collaborating across organizational boundaries, working with and influencing others, and creating clarity from confusion. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Outcome-oriented. Not reactionary, articulates the desired outcome and works collaboratively to create a path to achieve it. jobTitle: Manager of program managers, Customer and Retail Technology Programs (Seattle OR Remote)
jobDescription: Job Summary And Mission The Customer and Retail Technology (CRT) team is responsible for the product management, design, engineering and ongoing sustainment of all customer facing digital products. This includes the Starbucks Rewards app, all digital consumer marketing platforms, the Point of Sale, and the various customer facing software and hardware solutions in our stores. The Program Management Office supporting the CRT team at Starbucks is looking for an experienced manager of program managers to join our team. This role is a mix of responsibilities including annual, quarterly, and ongoing planning and portfolio governance on behalf of CRT, quality oversight of the programs within their portfolio, and team management of 2-5 Program Managers, Project Managers and Project Coordinators. This role operates at both a strategic and a tactical level and requires the proven experience to partner and collaborate with IT and business stakeholders at the IC, Manager, Director, VP and SVP level. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Participates in annual operational and financial planning and quarterly reforecasting efforts for the CRT portfolio of work Supports ongoing CRT Intake Process, Demand Management and Capacity Management functions Maintains an understanding of projects within the portfolio to ensure the identification and management of cross-program dependencies and synergies and maintains a roadmap that illustrates in-flight and planned projects within a portfolio Provides feedback, coaching and guidance to the Program and Project Managers within their Portfolio team Builds and manages a high-performing team of project and program managers by making good hiring decisions, setting clear individual and team expectations, holding team members accountable to their commitments, fostering strong team collaboration, and supporting career growth. Responsible for setting goals for the work group, developing organizational capability, and modeling how we work together. This includes designing, planning and championing change management and improvement initiatives within the PMO and across CRT. Basic Job Qualifications Minimum of two years’ experience as a manager of program managers Minimum 4 years managing complex large-scale programs in a Product Engineering organization. Including leading or participating in the shift from traditional waterfall project management and project funding model to Product-funded, complex software engineering projects. Minimum 8 years managing complex large-scale business or information technology programs Demonstrated experience managing a program management team through a major change/transformation. E.g. building a new PMO or significantly changing the focus, processes and structure of a PMO. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree; PMP considered Experience as a program manager in the Retail Industry preferred All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Now Brewing – Maintenance Manager! #tobeapartner   From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrates coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing and supporting partners who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. The Starbucks experience starts in our Roasting Plants where we have a dedicated team of professional roasters and supporting process teams including planning, warehouse management, packaging, roasting, maintenance, engineering and logistics.  This job contributes to Starbucks success by overseeing the development and implementation of sound plant maintenance programs that meet plant and company standards and regulatory requirements. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. Summary of Key Responsibilities:   Leadership   Setting goals for the work group, developing organizational capability, and modeling how we work together:   Identifies and communicates key responsibilities and practices to ensure the immediate team of direct reports promotes a successful attitude, confidence in leadership, and teamwork to achieve business results.   Supports the implementation of company programs to ensure the success of the Company.     Planning and Execution Developing strategic and operational plans for the work group, managing execution, and measuring results:   Plans and manages business unit and department processes and practices to ensure that programs are aligned with company business goals and objectives. Prepares, communicates and educates client groups and team on changes in policies and practices within the organization.  Business Requirements Providing functional expertise and executing functional responsibilities:  Anticipates, recognizes and assesses situations quickly and organizes resources to take appropriate action. Collaborates with engineers, suppliers, contracts and plant partners to ensure customer needs are met. Controls operating costs within budget expectations. Develops and maintains plant preventive maintenance programs. Ensures compliance with government regulatory agencies. Leads efforts to upgrade facility for efficiency, safety and reliability. Leads projects involving installation, modification or renovation of equipment. Manages repairs and supplies, purchases and budgets. Responsible for the management and/or implementation of food safety, legality and quality programs.  Partner Development & Team Building   Providing partners with coaching, feedback, and developmental opportunities and building effective teams:  Challenges and inspires team members to achieve business results.   Conducts and ensures the completion of performance reviews.   Ensures partners adhere to legal and operational compliance requirements.   Oversees training and development of partners directly and indirectly managed and makes effective staffing decisions.   Provides coaching, direction and leadership support to team members in order to achieve partners, business and customer results.  We’d Love To Hear From People With Developing and leading plant-specific quality, customer service and cost optimization programs (3 years) Consumer products or food company and plant experience, either technical or production Management Managing and developing others Managing budgets  Team-building skills Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing Ability to solve complex problems and follow through to solution Ability to provide leadership, with the ability to coach and mentor team partners Analytical and quantitative skills Ability to build relationships Proficient in safety procedures Familiarity with American Institute of Baking (AIB), Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), and Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP) standards Familiarity with food safety regulatory requirements and global standards including Preventive Controls for Human Food (21 CFR 117) and the Global Food Safety Initiative (GFSI). Experience with BRC or SQF certification schemes   All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.   We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.   Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. jobTitle: manager, portfolio management – US Licensed Stores (Beverage)
jobDescription: Now Brewing - manager, portfolio management– US Licensed Stores (Beverage) #tobeapartner! From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. As Manager on Portfolio Management for US Licensed Stores (Beverage), you will… Help us shape the future of our multibillion-dollar US LS product portfolio. You will join a high caliber team with independent decision making, breadth of work from strategy to execution, and direct access both marketing & product functions. You will drive holistic portfolio management, meeting customer needs in both existing and new channels. Responsibilities include forecasting sales, determining inventory investment levels, analyzing performance, and supporting portfolio strategy. You will deliver revenue and margin growth for both Starbucks and Licensees that operate in a diverse set of environments representing +40% of the total US store portfolio. We craft the narrative of the US LS business You will own business reporting directly to our leadership team, influencing how executive stakeholders interpret business performance. You will forecast, track, analyze and communicate business performance vs. expectations. You will leverage specific licensee insights & analytics to inform go-to-market strategy, new product development, platform positioning, & pricing tactics. We lead multimillion-dollar investment decisions to support sales of our most critical products You will accelerate licensee innovation by creating business cases for new programs that support growth strategies across critical strategic initiatives, improving licensee speed to market and optimizing the customer experience. You will develop deep functional expertise of our Licensees across unique and varied segments, like grocery, retail, travel, and theme parks, to make tailored inventory investment recommendations which will ensure mutual profitability. We make day-to-day operational decisions to get our products into customers’ hands You will serve as the liaison between our product team and the supply/demand planning team to resolve real issues that impact our stores, like prioritizing products to ship when we have ingredient shortages. We’d Love To Hear From People With Financial analysis and modeling experience (3+ years) Experience in product/brand management (2+ years) Experience in a role managing 2 or more budgets or product lines (2+ years) Strong cross-functional leadership Keen critical thinking skills and strong analytical ability Ability to simplify and structure complex and ambiguous problems Strong communication and ability to present learnings and outcomes to leadership Ability to influence others without authority BA Degree MBA preferred Join us and be part of something bigger. Apply today! Starbucks and its brands are an equal opportunity employer of all qualified individuals. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. Job Summary And Mission At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit– one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks Technologists work to achieve this mission through the use of cutting-edge technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities. The Customer Experience Engineering team is seeking a people-first manager to lead the Producer team. This team has a direct impact on delivering a great Web and Mobile customer experience by providing an agile-driven technical delivery and release management service across multiple cross-functional teams. This team is responsible for facilitating, planning, reporting, evolving agile processes, and ensuring roadblocks are visible and removed to drive value. Working in Starbucks Customer Experience Engineering provides opportunities to innovate and improve on digital product experiences which are used by millions of customers every day. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Coordinate and manage technical delivery (coordination/release management) of technology solutions across iOS, Android, and Web platforms. Oversee application delivery services, planning, development, and deployment strategy, including goal definition and timelines for Starbucks enhancements and projects. Model leadership behaviors that are grounded in Starbucks Mission and Values. Serve and grow a thriving team by driving engagement, development, and performance of all team members Leverage agile methodologies and tools to improve the process, to drive team efficiency, to reduce waste, and to increase flow. Participate in release related meetings, development of requirements and specifications. Monitor problems, provide solutions, and implement changes as necessary to ensure development and release timelines are met. Report progress regularly to cross-functional internal and external stakeholders; manage and communicate ongoing changes in tasks, goals, or performance. Manage a team that generates release schedules in partnership with Product Management, Design and Engineering including work back schedule for key milestones including User Story completion, Design readiness, Dev start & complete, QA start & complete. Lead a team to enforce the defined product scope/MVP and delivery priorities. Identify risks and communicate impacts to release schedule by working closely with product, engineering, and QA to manage mitigation. Partner with Product Management and Technical Product Management teams to ensure backlog prioritization and story readiness Manage consistent and timely delivery and maintenance of product dashboards, release schedules, and agile team reporting. Summary Of Experience Technology producer or project management delivery role (7 years) Experience managing digital product delivery and release in an agile environment (5 years) Defining and executing SDLC processes for product delivery teams (5 years) Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or higher or equivalent experience in related field Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Manage the delivery of technical solution/services to support scheduled release trains. Manage delivery team resources (offshore and onsite) in terms of resource planning and the prioritization of workload. Provide release architecture, development guidance and project management responsibilities that delivers on consulting, planning, development, and support of aligned processes towards releases. Supports our mobile and web team of onsite and offshore, including contingent workers, for the purpose of delivering new features and enhancements on our iOS, Android and Web platforms using Agile methodologies. Able to work across multiple disciplines to alignment on digital product delivery expectations. Knowledge and experience with latest agile tools/methodologies preferred (Jira, Kanban, Scrum) Superior oral and written communication skills. Strong coaching and mentoring abilities. Able to understand complex interdependencies of product delivery Demonstrates intellectual curiosity. Strong analytical skills. Ability to manage multiple priorities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. jobTitle: manager, supplier service delivery - retail infrastructure
jobDescription: Are you looking for a new, challenging role with lots of opportunities? Have experience building high performing teams? Interested in being part of modernizing supplier management to support the future of Starbucks? Then this role might be for you! The Retail Infrastructure Supplier Services team manages the technology suppliers that help us deploy, repair and support technology in the 10,000 company owned stores in the US and CA. With broad scope, this team is at the core of helping transform Starbucks business to support its future growth. As the manager for this team, extensive experience managing teams in a highly matrixed organization will be required to ensure your success. With accountability for $300M in annual supplier spend, the ability to develop collaborative partnerships with suppliers, provide oversight and leadership to ongoing evaluation of supplier execution continual improvement activities will be a core function of this role. This position also includes a significant consultative component, often pulled in on company-wide program-related matters to provide guidance and leadership, The right candidate will also model and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Ensures clear roles and responsibilities across the team and continually educates peer teams and business partners Identifies and communicates key responsibilities and practices to ensure the immediate team of direct reports achieve business results. Models and promotes a growth mindset within the team and across other teams that highlights the benefits of continual learning. Manages performance reviews, quarterly personal development goals and 1:1 coaching for the team to ensure ongoing partner growth and opportunities are actively worked on and managed. Helps team build strategies and supports successful execution across three primary verticals: Supply Chain/Var, Repair & Maintenance and Technology Installation. Establishes work in-take and prioritization processes across the entire portfolio; leads trade-off and prioritization conversations with key stakeholders to ensure the right work is completed while balancing workload across the team members. Continually revisits the technology strategy for each supplier vertical and ensures we are delivering to that strategy and making adjustments as business conditions change. Establishes a regular communication cadence to key stakeholders and business partners, ensuring they are aware of the work underway and the value being delivered. Plans and manages the team processes and practices, including rhythm of business activities. (MBR, QBR, monthly/quarterly finance reviews). Leads a close partnership with Sourcing to ensure that all supplier contracts are appropriate, include outcome focused measurements and KPI’s, balancing the cost with quality of the deliverables. Summary Of Experience Proven experience working with technology suppliers in a retail or quick-serve restaurant environment: 6+ years Team building and management experience: 10+ years Prior experience managing capital and operational spend in a Retail environment including Return on Investment and Total Cost of Ownership assessments preferred – 5 years Ability to aggregate a variety of customer demands to produce a single forecast view for suppliers Advanced skills in the MS Office Product Suite, particularly Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Power Automate, Flows and PowerBI or similar reporting/analysis tools. Proficient in establishing data collection and analysis processes that leads to the identification of continual improvement opportunities and implementation: 5 years Leading RFP’s, contract creation, oversight and management of strategic partnership: 7 years Advanced skills in the MS Office Product Suite, particularly Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Power Automate, Flows and PowerBI or similar reporting/analysis tools. Leadership And Communication Leads by example – with confidence, a positive attitude, patience, honesty and integrity, and a strong sense of commitment. Ability to ‘read the room’, to know what is possible and what is not, and to know how to navigate program and project engagements efficiently and effectively. Ability to engage in difficult conversations that result in positive, actionable outcomes. Able to coach and mentor peers as well, influencing toward a growth mindset. Seeks and provides honest, transparent feedback. Thrives in ambiguity and leads teammates through unknown issues, documenting and clarifying along the way. Builds consensus and gets teammates to align to new ways of conducting business. Can fully negotiate challenges with minimal management involvement. Excellent written and verbal communication. Sees ambiguity as a noteworthy challenge, providing leadership to the entire stakeholder team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
