jobTitle: manager tech solutions – Connect Retail Canada, SEATTLE OR REMOTE
jobDescription: This position contributes to Starbucks success by leading the definition, deployment, and support of technology solutions supporting retail technology our Canada Licensed Stores. As a manager, you are ultimately accountable for the success of your team's retail technology products and services. This role is responsible for crafting the technology vision, guiding the selection of services, and enabling retail solutions across a broad set of licensee store locations. Effective management of Connect Retail solutions requires strong customer service orientation and a continuous improvement mindset. Given the speed to market needed to support our Licensed Stores, this role must lead the team in executing the deployment roadmap. The ability to lead, influence, and collaborate effectively with others is critical to success in this role. The manager passionately fosters team member development in the context of a high-performing team consistently delivering business value and exceptional customer service. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Leadership - Setting goals for the work group, developing organizational capability, and modeling how we work together: Identifies and communicates key responsibilities and practices to ensure the immediate team of direct reports promotes a successful attitude, confidence in leadership, and teamwork to achieve business results. Supports the implementation of the Connect program in Canada to ensure the success of the Company. Innovation – Foster a culture of innovation and thought leadership. Cultivate innovative concepts and provide opportunities to transform ideas into technology solutions. Strategy & Roadmap – Accountable for strategy and capability roadmap (translating capabilities into technology solutions) for area of responsibility Solutions Approach – During project definition/initiation, accountable for defining high-level, shared vision/approach. Thoughtfully coordinate the deployment of technology solutions to ensure an exceptional end-user experience Communication - Communicates effectively with positive impact. Listens attentively, processes, and takes appropriate action. Facilitates the discussion of conflicting issues between individuals and across groups. Expresses ideas clearly in documents and written communications. Plans communication that is clear in purpose, and key messages while considering audience needs. Planning and Execution - Developing strategic and operational plans for the work group, managing execution, and measuring results: Prepares, communicates and educates client groups and team on changes in policies and practices within the organization Plans and manages business unit and department processes and practices to ensure that programs are aligned with Canada LS business goals and objectives. Project Investments/Initiation – In partnership with the PMO, align on technology roadmap and portfolio priorities. Collaboratively manage project scope, budget, supporting business case, and resource requirements. Product/Service Management – Responsible for management of application configuration and services enabling required business capabilities. Develops and maintains personal and team expertise for retail technology solutions, business functions, and processes. Acts as focal point for the solutions and provides platform point of view for cross-cutting work, issues and decisions. Technology Leadership –Understands and coordinates potential dependencies across solution design, development, testing, deployment, support, and maintenance activities. Solution Support/Sustainment – Partners with relevant support functions to establish holistic 7*24 support model optimizing partner talent with offshore support options. Performs root cause analysis of issues and assess trends to identify required future investments. Vendor Management – Builds strong vendor relationships to influence product roadmaps while managing contractual arrangements and service-level agreement compliance. Business Requirements - Providing functional expertise and executing functional responsibilities: Industry Knowledge – Remain informed of relevant technology and retail business trends, enabling strong contributions to the strategic planning process. Business Partnership – Advocates and aligns business objectives with technology strategies to deliver retail solutions enabling strategic business initiatives and delivering operational efficiencies. Barista Experience – Passionately focused on the seamless deployment of technology solutions delivering an exceptionally engaging and efficient user experience for our Baristas. Partner Development & Team Building - Providing partners with coaching, feedback, and developmental opportunities and building effective teams: Challenges and inspires team members to achieve business results. Conducts and ensures the completion of performance reviews. Ensures partners adhere to legal and operational compliance requirements. Oversees training and development of partners directly and indirectly managed and makes effective staffing decisions. Provides coaching, direction and leadership support to team members in order to achieve partners, business and customer results Our partners are key to our success: engage continuously to attract and develop talent with business acumen, technical expertise, and thought leadership. Responsible for recruitment and selection through talent career management: Performance Management – Accountable for the productivity, work quality, collaboration, and positive, engaging behavior of team members. Provides partners with coaching, feedback, and developmental opportunities supporting career development and formation of effective teams. Ability to manage teams comprised of functional, technical, and/or analytical professionals at a variety of levels. Talent Planning – Plans future talent requirements to support technology strategy and delivery roadmaps. Identifies required skills and determines approach to address gaps via partner development and/or incremental talent acquisition. Resource Planning – Fully understands and plans for required resources across solution support and delivery efforts. Ensures required resource capacity and skill coverage through internal and timely external staff augmentation as appropriate. Summary Of Experience 10+ years of relevant experience 5+ years of relevant functional, business, and/or industry experience Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Experience in retail point-of-sale and payment systems Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities Strong knowledge and demonstrated application of all facets of systems development lifecycle and technology operations. Collaboratively and objectively assesses benefits, costs, and viability of proposed solution options and drives alignment across a diverse group of stakeholders. Leadership in the utilization of agile prototyping, development, and testing to deploy highly engaging technology solutions to the end user. Working knowledge of Agile SCRUM solution design/development methodology and practices. Ability to leverage business knowledge, sound judgment, and resourcefulness to determine appropriate course of action in challenging, ambiguous situations. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to engage with and present ideas to senior leadership. Provides key input to facilitate decision-making process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, vete

Now Brewing – Transfer Pricing Manager! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. As a Transfer Pricing Manager, you will be part of a dynamic transfer pricing team with a focus on operational transfer pricing, working cross functionally, driving strategy, planning, execution, and ongoing maintenance, while supporting transfer pricing compliance and audit activities. As a Transfer Pricing Manager, you will… Oversee and review the preparation and maintenance of transfer pricing calculations and analysis, including identifying and gathering data requirements, data collection and reporting, to ensure completeness of data required to support complex and material transfer pricing calculations, and compliance obligations. Lead and oversee implementation of transfer pricing policies, ensuring transfer pricing requirements are met, including adherence to Starbucks Global transfer pricing policies. Conduct functional analyses interviews relating to intercompany transactions and to ascertain benefit to foreign affiliates and determine corresponding intercompany recharges. Manage and review benchmarking analyses for purposes of ascertaining the arm’s length nature of intercompany transactions. Manage and draft intercompany agreements. We’d Love To Hear From People With Undergraduate in accounting, finance or business related field Certified public accountant, chartered accountant, licensed attorney, or equivalent work experience. Recent transfer pricing experience in public accounting or large public company, 7+ years. Excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to effectively communicate technical tax information to both tax and non-tax customers Exceptional attention to detail and organization Ability to think strategically, communicate vision, and execute plans to meet business objectives Ability to work independently and as part of a team; organized and attentive to details; ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines Ability to build and maintain positive working relationships with peers across the finance organization. Intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, Power Point, and Word Join us and be part of something bigger. Apply today! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. jobTitle: market research & insights sr manager- Seattle
jobDescription: Job Summary And Mission From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing and supporting partners who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. As a Starbucks Market Research & Insights senior manager, you will inspire teams and leaders to take action and make decisions by serving as the champion of our Customers and Partners (employees). In this role, you will independently lead the execution of research on strategic initiatives, to provide actionable insights into our Customer and Partner (employee) experience. You will leverage your deep knowledge of research methods, analytics and synthesis to build compelling, persuasive cases for action. You will serve as a trusted partner/advisor and collaborate with a wide variety of teams, spanning—among others— Marketing, Operations, and Partner Resource organizations while influencing decisions at the highest levels of the company. Leveraging Your Previous Experience, We Will Enable You To Lead the execution of research and deliver insights on strategic initiatives that impact the Customer and Partner experience. Innovate Starbucks research approaches to add value and incremental research capabilities to an already robust toolkit Collaborate with business partners and team members to translate business questions into research designs, analytics plans and customized reports Independently design, execute, analyze and report custom research projects across both Customer and Partner to test hypotheses and more deeply explore themes identified in tracking programs Serve as an influencer, representing the voice of our Customers and Partners through compelling storytelling We’d Love To Hear From People With Broad Generalist background with knowledge and experience with both quantitative and qualitative research methods Strong knowledge and experience with tracking programs such as Brand Equity, Customer Experience, Employee Satisfaction, etc. Experience independently leading end-to-end research, from scoping to planning, executing and reporting The ability to see the big picture, taking strategic approaches to research plans Demonstrated curiosity to explore data and understand linkages between datasets and business outcomes Strong knowledge of statistics (descriptive and inferential) and their use in quantitative research methods Compelling, persuasive oral and written communication skills to executive audiences Proven ability to build strong cross-functional relationships Proficiency with SPSS, Excel and other statistical software packages Business experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) Client-side market research experience with CPG or Retail #transformation All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Now Brewing – Materials Specialist! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrates coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing and supporting partners who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. The Starbucks experience starts in our Roasting Plants where we have a dedicated team of professional roasters and supporting process teams including planning, warehouse management, packaging, roasting, maintenance, engineering and logistics. As a Materials Specialist, You Will Complete required documentation of raw material movement. Maintain scheduled production throughout levels to meet team goals for reliability and budget standards. Coordinate movement of raw materials from the warehouse to production locations. Initiate material moves to Work in Process (WIP) locations based on data from transfer reports. Review and act upon messages from the computerized inventory system. Manage dock door and track incoming purchase orders. Work with scheduling partners to identify shortages in production plan and communicate to appropriate departments and partners. Work with the materials management team and Support Center to resolve material variances, set up new raw materials in work-in-process locations, perform inventory counts, reconcile and make visual checks of on-hand raw materials and execute test requests. Understand and follow established safety guidelines, programs and procedures; and actively work to prevent safety incidents. Support food safety, legality and quality programs. Maintain product quality through adherence to good manufacturing practices, Food Safety Preventative Controls, product specifications and quality procedures. Monitor and document quality measures using analytical tools. Perform other duties as needed in support of business objectives and Starbucks Mission & Values. Maintain regular and consistent attendance and punctuality. We’re proud to invest in you and offer these special incentives to eligible partners (employees): Comprehensive health coverage (Medical, Dental and Vision) Arizona State University College Achievement Plan: FULL tuition reimbursement towards bachelor’s degree Highly competitive 401(k) program with company match at 5% Stock equity reward program (annual grants) Health savings, vacation savings & health and wellness programs Paid vacation (prorated vacation allowance on day one), sick leave and personal days We’d love to hear from people with the following experience: Manufacturing or distribution environment (2 years) Regulated food manufacturing environment (1 year) High school diploma/GED, US military service or equivalent Ability to and communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing Ability to collect, record and report on material requirements using manual or automated systems Ability to perform inventory counts and identify ways to minimize material outages Ability to operate stand up reach trucks and counterbalance powered industrial trucks Ability to understand written policies and guidelines, specifications and safety standards Basic math skills Ability to work in accordance with safety, quality and sanitation standards, policies and procedures Ability to work variable shifts to support business needs Knowledge of Material Resource Planning (MRP) systems and their applications Forklift Operator certification (Preferred) Familiarity with food safety regulatory requirements and global standards including Preventive Controls for Human Food (FDA Code of Federal Regulations) and the Global Food Safety Initiative (GFSI). Experience with the GFSI certification schemes (i.e. BRC and/or or SQF). (Preferred) All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. Job Summary And Mission From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. As a manager of data science, you will partner with the Inclusion & Diversity team to provide analytics and insights that help the team develop a diverse and inclusive workforce, set and maintain representation goals, and create accountability at leadership levels. You will lead a small team of data scientists or data analysts who leverage statistical analysis, data visualization, and storytelling to help us monitor our progress and identify new opportunities. Your team will extract data for affirmative action plans, pay equity, EEO reporting, Starbucks I&D board reporting, I&D training, employee network groups and other I&D data needs. You will build strong relationships with cross-functional business teams (including Inclusion & Diversity and Human Resources), collaborate closely with technology teams, and identify ways to improve existing processes or analytical approaches. You will coach and develop your team, helping them to drive impact while growing their careers at Starbucks. As a manager data scientist, you will… Serve as an embedded data science thought partner for business stakeholders, helping to define and shape business questions and translate them into actionable analytical questions Build and scale creative data science solutions to solve unique and challenging business problems Promote and advocate value of data science (including AI and ML) to solve business problems We’d Love To Hear From People With 5 years’ experience in data science BA or BS with concentration in quantitative discipline, MS preferred Experience with employee or people data, diversity and inclusion, and/or EEO compliance data Advanced competency and expertise in SQL and either Python or R Experience building and leading teams From free coffee to competitive pay, Starbucks is proud to offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package to our eligible part-time and full-time partners. Benefits include 100% tuition coverage through our Starbucks College Achievement Plan, health coverage with a variety of plans to choose from, and stock & savings programs like our equity reward program, Bean Stock. What’s more, Starbucks offers flexible scheduling and opportunities for paid time off. Visit starbucksbenefits.com for details. If you live in the greater Seattle area, we offer a flexible workplace that allows for hybrid work. Partners can work remotely up to four days per week and leverage the office 1-2 days per week, on average. Now Brewing – Future Leaders! #tobeapartner As a District Manager you enjoy the journey of developing extraordinary Store Managers, creating great customer experiences, impacting growth across Starbucks stores and being part of local communities. At Starbucks we are performance driven through the lens of humanity. You direct a multi-unit portfolio of stores by planning strategies and consistent implementation. You are a leader of leaders, developing diverse teams that know their markets, communities and customers. Benefit Information Using Your Past Retail Leadership Experience You Will Grow a portfolio of successful businesses: develop district-level strategies to achieve each store’s financial, operational and customer-service goals, while addressing each store’s unique strengths and challenges. Lead a team of leaders: motivate, coach and strengthen Store Managers as team leaders, retail operators and business owners. Serve as a resource: provide expertise on key customer issues, team staffing and management, store operations and company policies and procedures. We'd Love To Hear From People With 5+ years of retail experience managing 2 or more stores, departments or units, P&L, inventory, operations and customer service 5+ years of management experience leading a team of 6 or more, including training and coaching, with strong leadership and communication skills 3+ years of experience in a customer service oriented role Experience in a multi-unit environment, knowledge of retail or restaurant industry operations and financial reporting Strong organizational, interpersonal and problem solving skills Minimum High School or GED. Note: a college degree in business or a closely related field, OR 4+ years of US Military service may substitute for a portion of the required experience Requirements Legal documentation establishing your identity and eligibility to be legally employed in the country in which you apply. Ability to work full time (the work regularly demands in excess of 40 hours per week) including variable hours including early mornings, evenings, weekends and/ or holidays. jobTitle: mgr global logistics II, Supply Chain
jobDescription: This job contributes to Starbucks success by leading the design and implementation of logistics platforms, processes and systems across the Starbucks network. Facilitates development of processes and systems that are cost-effective and that accommodate global growth and generate value for Starbucks stores and customers. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Leadership - Setting goals for the work group, developing organizational capability, and modeling how we work together: Identifies and communicates key responsibilities and practices to ensure the immediate team of direct reports promotes a successful attitude, confidence in leadership, and teamwork to achieve business results. Provides a common vision, sets priorities and defines roles and responsibilities for partners and cross-functional work teams. Supports the implementation of enterprise-wide and department priority programs to ensure the success of the Company. Planning and Execution - Developing strategic and operational plans for the work group, managing execution, and measuring results: Develops and manages resource plans for various initiatives. Develops financial plans and aligns them with stakeholders. Develops logistics strategies to support internal and external business partners, including distribution network infrastructure, transportation trade lane alignment, proactive capacity planning for distribution centers and transportation and identification and alignment of system tool needs with the business. Develops metrics and reports to monitor internal performance and thrid party logistics, carriers and provider goals. Develops, aligns and implements the environmental strategies for global logistics to complement Starbucks global Corporate Social Responsibility program. Develops, aligns and implements the outsourcing strategy for global logistics providers including third party logistics (3PLs), carriers and value added service providers. Plans and manages business unit or department processes and practices to ensure that programs are aligned with company business goals and objectives. Prepares, communicates and educates business partners and team on changes in policies and practices within the organization. Liaises and negotiates with suppliers and customers. Provides a clear vision and goals for the global logistics team. Responsible for developing the long-term strategic planning of operations and service levels globally which are aligned to the overall, growth plans of the global business Responsible for establishing and implementing the strategy to reduce overall logistics costs through optimization and provider consolidation (where applicable). Responsible for overall implementation of the business strategy by setting priorities to which the industry and Starbucks and business units are targeted. Business Requirements - Providing functional expertise and executing functional responsibilities: Be knowledgeable of the regulatory and legal aspects as relating to the economics of distribution and transportation; as well as all aspects of distribution services, costs, operations and negotiations. Coordinates and controls the strategy and tactics that impact order cycle and associated information systems. Coordinates with internal business units and external customers to identify their needs and expectations and develops appropriate tactical and strategic solutions. Cross-functional liaison between Starbucks business units and supply chain operations (Demand / Supply - Planning, IT, Finance, Procurement and Manufacturing). Develops and implements reporting processes to communicate project status to project teams and other stakeholders. Ensure organizational priorities are communicated to Supply Chain field partners in a timely and effective manner. Ensure that organizational priorities are communicated to team in a timely & actionable manner. Ensures that customer care and supplier management processes policies and guidelines are up to date, aligned with all supply chain teams, and accessible to appropriate partners. Identifies and manages both innovation and optimization (eg : value added service) opportunities (including service / cost improvement initiatives throughout global logistics). Lead in continuously improving performance across the total supply chain. Leads design and implementation of common distribution processes and systems across the Starbucks network. Ensures that processes and systems improve service, gain efficiencies, increase capacity and reduce costs. Leads the design and implementation of distribution network models that support business decisions for global market growth and distribution, transport, capacity and location requirements. Manages partner's skill development around technical logistics management processes. Manages strategic relationships with Starbucks business units, functional areas and internal and external distribution service providers to support overall business requirements around the raw material, manufactured and retail supply chains. Manages the process for evaluating bids, negotiating contracts and monitoring performance of third-party logistics and carriers. Oversee the implementation and execution of internal and external supply chain distribution processes, systems and technology that direct and disseminate flow of information while producing economic and efficiency benefits to all business partners. Partners with Tax and Customs partners to design, implement and manage processes to ensure compliance with customs regulations around the world. Assists with customs audits. Provide operational oversight to logistics contracts negotiated by procurement. Represent Starbucks best interests to local, state, federal agencies. Responsible for all aspects of third-party supplier management for distribution centers and central distribution centers operations (e.g., day-to-day contract administration including defining key performance indicators and holding vendors accountable to metrics, conducting periodic business reviews, ensuring timely and effective launch of new programs). Support the logistics policy enterprise wide. Uses problem-solving and alternatives analysis methodologies to assess the financial and operational impact of business initiatives. Assesses critical information required to make effective decisions or recommendations for process changes. Partner Development & Team Building - Providing partners with coaching, feedback, and developmental opportunities and building effective teams: Challenges and inspires partners to achieve business results. Conducts and ensures the completion of performance reviews. Ensures partners adhere to legal and operational compliance requirements. Oversees training and development of partners directly and indirectly managed and makes effective staffing decisions. Provides coaching, direction and leadership support to team members in order to achieve partners, business and customer results. Summary Of Experience Client Management / Client Customer Care (7 years) Negotiating, budgeting and managing relationships with third party logistics providers (6 years) Developing outsourcing strategies (5 years) Implementation of warehouse and inventory systems (5 years) Managing a Team (5 years) Project management (4 years) Strategic planning (3 years) Network layout and process design (distribution &/or transportation) Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Team-building skills Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing Ability to provide technical leadership Ability to work independently Results-oriented /div> All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backg

Paralegal II – Traditional Labor and Employment—Seattle, Washington or California From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrates coffee and its rich tradition, but that creates a feeling of connection. We develop and support partners (employees) who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. “We’re in the people business serving coffee, not the coffee business serving people.” As a Starbucks paralegal II – Traditional Labor & Employment, you will provide timely and effective legal support to attorneys, clients, outside counsel, other paralegals and members of the Law & Corporate Affairs Department on traditional labor law and employment law matters. This includes responding to NLRB unfair labor practice charges, EEOC and state agency charges, attorney demand letters, as well as traditional labor and employment litigation brought against the company. This paralegal will manage complex traditional labor and employment projects and will work with outside counsel. This paralegal will also collect and organize documents and other information in response to discovery requests, schedule and participate in interviews of partners, review and organize responses to subpoenas, and provide a variety of related support. We are seeking applicants who can collaborate effectively across groups and can anticipate and initiate routine legal tasks independently and as requested by Starbucks attorneys and outside counsel. We’d Love To Hear From People With Traditional Labor Law experience Employment Law experience 3+ years of relevant paralegal experience Law firm or in-house legal department experience Advanced subject-matter expertise in this area of law Interpersonal skills Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing Arbitration and Trial experience a plus We hope to hear from you! From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are looking for a manager, partner resources, labor relations, who will be part of a dedicated cross-functional team to provide labor relations support to partners and our leaders throughout retail, manufacturing, and distribution. This role will provide expertise and decision-making support to local leaders and support teams in daily operations, campaigns, and at the bargaining table. They will also support contract implementation and interpretation, and all labor relations' processes to proactively uplift the partner experience across the organization by leading with dignity and respect for our partners, generating insights, leveraging analytics & data to generate insights, and acting as an advocate for all partners. This is an incredible opportunity for a partner to work cross-functionally across the organization and directly with the local retail leadership team, driving labor relations strategy to uplift the partner experience while proactively supporting leadership in achieving excellence. We are looking for someone who demonstrates Starbucks Mission & Values and has a track record of achieving excellence through delivering on priorities, problem-solving, building capability and leadership, and developing high performing teams. Knowledgeable of labor laws and labor relations processes including, collective bargaining, grievance processes, contract administration and labor management relationships. Provides perspective and labor relations expertise on applicable operational and PRO policies and processes to best support the Retail Operating Model (consideration of the Partner, Customer and Business impact). Leverages market experiences, data and insights to develop strategies and tactics in partnership with leadership, legal teams and PRO to uplift the partner experience while reducing labor and operational risk. Maintains composure through challenging experiences and demonstrates integrity and discretion at all times, including at the bargaining table and in work disruptions. Collaborates with cross-functional teams and leaders to remain current on all tools, resources, policies, procedures, laws and precedent, and standards to achieve operational excellence. Demonstrates professional facilitation skills by delivering labor relations training to build leadership confidence and capability. Strong communication – able to communicate clearly and concisely, both verbal and written; able to articulate, interpret and respond to nonverbal communication. Ability to influence – able to articulate perspective and influence through negotiation and effective verbal and written communication skills to peers and leaders. Strong resilience – demonstrates confidence, composure, and professionalism despite challenging negotiations; able to persevere and quickly overcome adversity. Strong emotional intelligence – demonstrates the ability to understand their own emotions and the emotions of others; able to respond to emotions appropriately during negotiations. Ability to navigate technology - advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Teams, PowerPoint) and virtual tools. Knowledge of labor relations - understanding of or an ability to learn the labor and human resources related laws and regulations including but not limited to the National Labor Relations Act (NLRA), Title VII, ADA, ADAAA, ADEA, FMLA & state/local laws and ordinances. jobTitle: platform engineer II -Platforms & Payments- Seattle OR Remote
jobDescription: #nowbrewing: platform engineer II – Cloud Foundation Services The Cloud Foundation services team is looking for someone excited to work with Kubernetes,Amazon Web Services, and Go. We are building a platform that makes it easy to run micro services in a secure, scalable, and reliable way for Starbucks Technology. The platform engineer II is a key member of the team helping to build that customer focused platform as a service (PaaS). Job Summary And Mission At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks Technologists work to achieve this mission through the use of cutting-edge technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities. This job contributes to Starbucks success by delivering high-quality, reliable, and stable technologies and security capabilities in support of the Starbucks Engineering Platform. This position is accountable for the installation, configuration, monitoring, analysis, maintenance, and technical support of the platform. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Communicates complex ideas and concepts to non-technical peers and customers Ability to establish cross-functional, collaborative relationships with business and technology partners Support the development team and perform activities to resolve developer issues in a timely and accurate fashion Engineer build and release processes Ability to effectively manage and partner with technology vendors to deliver againstbusiness objectives Conducts research and makes recommendations on standards, products, and services Ensures application and infrastructure architectural solutions are stable, secure, and compliant with Company standards and practices Implements all technologies in accordance with Information Security's guiding principles for highly sensitive data Provide high-availability operational support and automate solutions across the environment Implements deep telemetry capabilities to provide ongoing success and performance metrics Implements service monitoring across all platforms to ensure continuous availability and operational continuity of critical systems Upholds company policies, and legal/regulatory requirements, such as PCI Implements and maintains system configurations and baselines to support secure application development software control best practices and standards Basic Qualifications Education (minimum education level, degree or certification necessary): 2-4 years of professional industry experience with software development Preferred Qualifications Skills (minimum skills required): Experience in system administration, network administration, and systems engineering Experience in one or more of the following languages: C, C++, Java, Python, Go, Perl and/or Ruby. Demonstrated ability to debug and optimize code, and automate routine tasks Interest in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems Knowledge in application development and supporting a development environment Experience with Cloud Computing platforms (e.g. Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google App Engine, Digital Ocean) Familiarity in TCP/IP networking, architecture and core technologies (DNS, routing, firewalls, etc.) The pay range for this position may be narrower than that displayed, depending on where the work is performed. From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are seeking a principal enterprise architect who focuses on developing and championing enterprise-wide strategies and patterns to inspire and enable connections in our Customer, Retail, and Partner spaces. As a principal enterprise architect within Starbucks Technology you lead the architecture development for global IT solutions for multiple domains. Principal architects are the senior EA leaders for their respective capability areas and are accountable for the conversion of business strategies into technology designs. As a senior member of the architecture community you will lead the development of best practices, process improvement, and champion architecture principles for all of Starbucks global IT operations. In this role, you will… Work closely with a variety of teams to develop technology strategies, architectural blueprints, roadmaps, and perspectives throughout Starbucks Guide other architects in devising meaningful ways to improve Starbucks business through shared roadmaps, technologies, and partnerships Advise cross-functional leaders in defining priorities, key initiatives, and organizational alignment to inform and supporting business decisions Identify and evaluate new technologies and software that enhance the Starbucks experience for Customers and Partners Inspire and guide strategic direction of technologies through active product and program engagement Develop, advocate, and manage principles, practices, patterns, and appropriate governance to help infuse new technologies and advanced analytics being deployed Identify and share architectural interdependencies between programs across the enterprise Assist in developing proposals for enterprise technology strategies based on environmental analysis, opportunity identification, value, and risk Enable the understanding and adoption of the technology architectures with product and service teams Lead in shaping technology of programs spanning multiple businesses in the enterprise to promote strategic technology transformation An ideal person for this job… Provides coaching, direction, and leadership support to team members to help them grow and achieve business results Takes calculated risks and challenges the status quo with tact all spheres of influence Contributes to a positive team environment by actively promoting a positive, respectful work environment Actively engage and create learning experiences Continuously seeks to understand and create value from the customers perspective Skills and experiences you’ll need to excel in this role… A people-first style, strong multi-audience communications, and high emotional intelligence Strong technology and human-centered design background with the ability to formulate clear strategies Ability to thrive in a diverse, global environment An aptitude to craft effective presentations and deliverables for non-technical audiences Demonstrated flexibility, adaptability, and an interpersonal style that meets the needs of individual customers Education, Training, & Experience 10 or more years of IT experience 7 or more years of department level (or greater) process design, technical proofs of concept, and/or solution design experience involving multiple technologies At least five years of architecture or enterprise level analytical experiences At least three years participating in departmental (or greater) strategic technology planning All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without At Starbucks Technology, we power moments of connection for our customers and partners (employees). Proudly investing in our talent is a key pillar of building the future. Our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks Technologists work to achieve this mission using cutting-edge technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities. Enterprise Architecture – Principal Architect Location: Remote Available – Occasional Travel We are seeking a Principal Enterprise Architect (EA) with focus on Supply Chain technologies to join the Starbucks Technology team. This role will lead and mature the architecture accountable for shaping the next generation of systems supporting our critical corporate products & services in Supply chain Sourcing, Manufacturing and Delivering. In This Critical Role, You Will Have deep understanding of end-to-end supply chain functions (Plan-Source-Make-Deliver) with a focus on supply chain operations, manufacturing and fulfilment. Deeply involved in creation of various architecture artifacts including, but not limited to, Technology reference models, Business Capability Models, Conceptual Architecture and Logical Architecture. Be responsible for performing Vendor assessments for evaluating SaaS solutions and participating in RFI (request for information) and RFP (request for proposal) processes. Experience working with different stakeholders including technology and business to understand their business pain points, define business objectives, and solution requirements. Responsible for developing long-range technology architecture and have vision in developing strategic architecture with the anticipation of future business needs. Act as a primary point of contact for enterprise architecture with one or more international markets (e.g. APAC, NA, EMEA, JP, China etc). Analyze enterprise business context (trends and business strategy), as well as change requirements in other enterprise architecture viewpoints, to derive the architecture future state. This includes defining the requirements, and models that guide technology decisions for the enterprise. Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge with an ability to quickly assimilate to new knowledge and possess good business acumen. Oversee and facilitate the research, evaluation and selection of hardware/software technology and product standards, as well as the design of standard configurations. Coordinate and partnering with other enterprise architects across the organization. Understand and advocate EA principles and be prepared to "sell" the EA process, its outcome and ongoing results. An ideal person for this job is a dynamic Technology evangelist that regularly challenges the status quo and leads by our Starbucks’ people-first culture. You have a relentless pursuit for excellence and exemplify leadership in the Supply Chain functions including Plan, Source, Make and Deliver. You must be a courageous leader who is comfortable with ambiguity and can lead through behavioral and structural transformation. Knowledge And Skills Master’s degree in computer science, or a related area of study, or Bachelor's degree and equivalent experience. Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience as an Enterprise Architect. Extensive experience in architecting Supply Chain systems with focus in Planning, Sourcing, Manufacturing and Delivery. Must have hands on experience and deep understanding of end-to-end supply chain functions (Plan-Source-Make-Deliver) with a focus on supply chain operations, manufacturing and fulfilment. Must have prior experience in performing build v/s buy analysis and vendor evaluations. Must have strong storytelling and presentation skills with an ability to ‘sell’ a vision. Ability to adapt and design short-term solutions while maintaining the “big picture”. Ability to translate high level needs into architecture requirements. Excellent written, verbal, communication and presentation skills with the ability to articulate new ideas and concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences. Excellent planning and organizational skills. Experience with TOGAF, Zachman or other architecture framework is a plus. Familiarity with cloud computing concepts is a plus. If this sounds like you, we’d like to have coffee!

Job Summary And Mission At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks Technologists work to achieve this mission through the use of cutting-edge technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities. The Marketing Technology (MarTech) team is responsible for defining and driving the technical strategy for the next generation of marketing solutions at Starbucks. Our goal is to create deep connections and highly personalized digital experiences that rival the world class experiences our customers have when visiting any of our stores around the globe. To accomplish this mission, we are using a combination of 3rd party & home-grown tech coupled with new ways of collaborating with our marketing partners. The technical product manager, principal has responsibility for facilitating the development lifecycle for specific areas within the MarTech ecosystem as well as serving as a change agent for the enhancement and extensibility of existing products and services within Starbucks Technology. This position is responsible for contributing to a shared strategic vision for Starbucks’ marketing tech stack by working closely with our external vendors and internal business partners. The right candidate will possess a strong technical product management background, with demonstrated experience in the solutioning for, and execution of products, services and features that create business value and deliver impact in the Marketing arena. This role will effortlessly find a balance between influence and partnership with a variety of cross-functional teams to define & align on: the roadmap, prioritization, solution architecture, and engineering approach associated with strategic initiatives at Starbucks. Summary Of Key Responsibilities The technical product manager, principal acts as a business owner for their area of the commerce platform and as a business owner team member for the commerce solution all up. Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Product Definition & Value Contributes innovative business capabilities and customer features informed by new technology trends and business strategy to the product or service roadmap Translates customer experience and business strategy requirements into technical requirements Influences decisions by providing technical consultation and direction to stakeholders Influences and documents non-functional requirements including performance, scalability, resilience, usability, accessibility, security, and business continuity Collaborates with peer technology teams to align on solutions Represents customer experience context to engineering teams Creates acceptance criteria/requirements to align with customer, business, and technical strategy goals Participates in the prioritization of the backlog Analysis & KPIs Analyzes data and uses results to justify product decisions and apply key learnings Defines product health, performance metrics, dashboard/reporting requirements, and KPIs to measure performance against feature goals Leads ongoing improvements to product performance Makes data-driven decisions making and uses quantitative analysis skills Leadership & Communication Partners with engineering teams to apply knowledge/expertise in defining technical requirements and solution architecture, and understands technical debt and non-functional features to prioritize appropriately Owns effective relationships with engineering teams across Starbucks Technology (ST) Interacts directly with Product Management to understand business issues and to communicate ramifications of technical options Eliminates ambiguity in feature criteria and goals Presents solution options/recommendations clearly and persuasively to support business stakeholder decisions Influences & negotiates with teams across Starbucks Technology, with business partners, and with third-party vendors and resolves most issues independently Coaches and mentors team members in Product Management skills, technical skills, and business acumen Product Planning & Delivery Identifies and documents technical tradeoffs as well as dependencies and constraints Presents recommendations and influences alignment across neighbor ST teams Performs validation of feature against stated goals; supports user review/acceptance testing Works with cross-functional engineering teams on feature sizing and release planning Practices iterative, agile development- Create epics, user stories, and partner with ST Product Management on acceptance criteria (ensure proper tagging, scalability, etc.) Manages execution and eliminates blocking issues during development Communicates product delivery milestones and progress Acts as a liaison between vendors and business Leads documentation of “to be” state i.e. API contracts including reconciliation and error handling, data flow diagrams and data mapping documents Partners with Engineering and UX on Design and Prototypes to support hypothesis for new feature discovery Tracks progression of KPIs and OKRs Facilitates bug triage, prioritization, and resolution timing by partnering with ST Product Management, Engineering, vendors, and across ST as needed Facilitates/Participates in Backlog Refinement, Sprint Planning, Sprint Retrospective, and Sprint Demos Ensures sprint plan aligns with Product Roadmap and Sprint Goals The pay range for this position may be narrower than that displayed, depending on where the work is performed. Experience, Skills And Knowledge Strong verbal and written communications skills, ability to quickly master new systems and/or processes, capacity to stay organized while managing competing priorities Hands on experience in developing technical roadmaps, story outlines, writing user stories, refining product backlogs, and coordinating/prioritizing conflicting requirements in a fast-paced, changing environment Detail- and results-oriented, able to analyze data to justify product decisions and apply key learnings. Ability to thoroughly understand complex business and technical issues and influence decision making Ability to plan for and review technical programming specifications Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities Strong verbal and written communications skills Consistently uses communications skills to influence outcomes Ability to influence others without authority to get things done in a timely fashion Ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines Strong knowledge of agile development practices, methodologies, and tools Ability to build consensus across a diverse group of stakeholders Deep understanding of the system architecture and design concepts behind complex, enterprise-class software solutions at high transaction volumes Familiarity with User Centered Design Technical knowledge in web application and SaaS is preferred. Strong knowledge of agile development practices, methodologies and tools (e.g. Jira, Rally). Preferred Qualifications 7+ years of industry experience as a product manager within a technology environment, with a record of successfully delivering complex products and services. 3+ years of experience in building applications in commerce and customer loyalty area 3+ years of experience in building web based applications Recent experience with Enterprise Software delivered as SaaS/Cloud Experience in identity, privacy, security applications is a plus Strong verbal and written communications skills, ability to quickly master new systems and/or processes, capacity to stay organized while managing competing priorities BA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience div> All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. As a Lead Product Developer, you will… Be highly skilled and experienced in managing end-to-end innovation, synthesizing research into opportunity identification and bringing concepts through to commercialization at scale for a variety of food products Lead multiple complex initiatives, solving for requirements of cross-functional teams, external vendors and partnerships to move projects forward Collaborate and influence cross-functionally to share information and support co-creation between teams Present technical findings, insights, and recommendations to a broad audience in a compelling and actionable way We’d Love To Hear From People With Basic Qualifications: Education Degree in Food Science, Nutrition or related scientific discipline Skills Deep knowledge and experience of product development and manufacturing scale up of food and/or beverage products Strong collaboration, communication, and problem-solving skills Years Of Experience In Specific Field Or Designated Skills 8 years Education Preferred Qualifications: Master's or advance degree in Food Science, Nutrition or related scientific discipline Skills Job/category specific product development/innovation and culinary experience (Beverage, RTD, Food, Bakery, etc.) Models principles and application of Human Centered Design (HCD) Applies Ingredient functionality, processing, quality assurance principles, food safety requirements Strong collaboration and problem-solving skills, managing projects and change Ability to work in a matrixed environment, effective in storytelling Join us and be part of something bigger. jobTitle: program manager Customer and Retail Technology (Seattle OR Remote)
jobDescription: Job Summary And Mission Are you interested in being part of a team that shapes the future of Customer and Retail technology at Starbucks? As a program manager, you will take the initiative to collaborate with various technical teams on highly innovative and complex, cross-functional programs, that will bring amazing customer experiences to the Starbucks mobile app and in-store technology. You will own the executive-level reporting and status, program budget and work closely with various stakeholder groups. You will bring 8 to 10 years experience in shipping visible, large cross-functional technical programs and will have the following responsibilities, knowledge, and skills: Program Planning Summary of Key Responsibilities You will bring Vision by collaborating with dynamic stakeholders to define the Program Scope, Deliverables and Critical Path dependencies You will bring Clarity to the team by developing schedule, budget, and resource plan You will bring Alignment and Transparency across to all stakeholders by implementing a governance and reporting structure You will leverage your financial expertise by helping to define program costs and secure program funding Program Execution You are a multi-tasker and can drive more than one project You bring people together and can collaborate across cross functional Technology and Business stakeholders You sweat the details, but you focus the team on what is most important with management of schedule, budget, issues, and risks You make things happen by removing roadblocks and addressing future impediments now. You bring energy to the program by inspiring optimism, creativity, shared commitment, and growth through times good and bad. Leadership And Communication You lead by example – with compassion, courage, consistency, and confidence You create a team environment of trust, integrity, and positive collaboration You are flexible and can accommodate diverse personality styles and remain neutral and balanced in all interactions You can engage in difficult conversations that result in fact-driven, positive, actionable outcomes You are always ‘reading the room,’ to know what the best possible outcome is and to guide the conversation and team members accordingly You are a champion decision-maker that favors data, compromise, and alignment over consensus-building Summary Of Experience Basic Qualifications (minimum needed to be qualified): 8 to 10 years experience in shipping visible, large cross-functional technical programs You are an expert at Program/Project Management and Agile Software Development Lifecycle and eager to advise and guide your peers; PMP Certification a plus Knowledgeable in Jira, Confluence, and Reporting Tools (Tableau) and at least one program portfolio management tool, e.g. MS project Portfolio Management (PPM) You are Conversant in Cloud, APIs, Services, and Database Technologies All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Now Brewing – Program Manager, Operations Sustainability! #tobeapartner   From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and rich tradition but also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. We are seeking a program manager on the Product and Inventory team in Operations Services who will deliver key sustainability initiatives such as launching compostable and reusable products, sustainability changes within store design and facilities, and supporting operational changes due to local mandates. This work also involves developing retail-facing resources, training, and change management plans to support the successful launches of these initiatives. Our goal is to support the company's sustainability goals while remaining focused on partner engagement and operational challenges. Leading the strategy for store operations on sustainability requires a passionate servant leader who is customer-focused, operations-minded, and a creative problem-solver. They will bring diverse viewpoints together and inspire a team while working in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment. As a program manager, you will… Lead a team of partners to deliver their very best and create meaningful careers. Develop strategic and operational plans for the team, manage execution, and measure results. Provide retail operations on programs and projects to optimize performance relative to sales, profitability, and the customer and partner experience. Lead high-performing, cross-functional, and often globally distributed teams to deliver complex, multi-year, multifaceted programs. Leverage the Starbucks Way to define the right problem to solve, set a clear vision, create an empowered team, choose a work method, and set up the environment for collaboration. Ensure proposed programs and projects align with company goals and strategies and communicate to all relevant stakeholders. Autonomously and appropriately apply knowledge, processes, skills, tools, and techniques to project and program activities to meet cross-program goals. Nimbly adapt to shifting priorities while assessing the overall health of existing programs and priorities. Drive decisions by influencing decision-makers and balancing risk and uncertainty across multiple projects, programs, and functions. Drive alignment across multiple senior leaders and influence cross-functional teams to support new ideas and decisions. Understand and share the reasoning behind critical organizational policies, practices, procedures, and cultures to navigate formal and informal channels. Optimize talent, materials, and budget between projects and ensures effective and efficient resource utilization across the program. We’d love to hear from people with the following: Qualifications BS in business or restaurant management is preferred but not required. 5 years of professional experience, including retail operations multi-unit management, or 5 years of experience applying industry-based project management and problem-solving methodologies (e.g., Waterfall, Agile, Human Centered Design, Continuous Improvement). Implementation of strategic plans, depending on the area of assignment for 2 years; Intra-company communications management, depending on the area of assignment for 2 years. Required Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional programs and projects. Ability to lead others, strong change management, problem-solving, and coaching skills Strong knowledge of supply chain and retail store operations, processes, and procedures. Ability to work accurately with a sense of urgency and deliver under tight timelines. jobTitle: Program Manager, Retail Infrastructure Technology Deployment
jobDescription: Job Summary And Mission This position contributes to Starbucks success by managing retail technology hardware deployment projects and larger programs across 10k+ company owned stores in North America. We are looking for a strong Program Manager to own and triage solutions to complex problems, become a subject matter expert in retail deployments and most importantly drive positive results that impact our store partners and customers. This position also requires experience creating projects and programs from the ground up, fostering strong relationships with our stakeholders, implementing cost / effort efficiencies, as well as holding all delivery parties accountable. Key traits and abilities we are looking for include strong communication skills, demonstrated experience managing risk, extensive experience managing vendors, a passion for process improvement and someone who can thrive in ambiguity. Really looking for someone with a background in retail hardware technology project management. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions inlude but are not limited to the following: Oversees tactical planning and day-to-day management of one or more programs in the IT portfolio. Collaborates with IT and business leadership on annual strategic planning for the program. In partnership with the program portfolio manager, engages stakeholders on project ideation and assists in the creation of business cases and return on investment assessments. Develops a deep understanding of projects within the program and the broader IT portfolio; manages assigned projects with a clear understanding of business and IT context, and develops a deep understanding of cross-program portfolio synergies and dependencies. Ensures alignment of proposed projects with the program roadmap and its goals, and manages project planning and execution accordingly. Drives complex, cross-functional enterprise projects, leading multiple efforts within a specific program simultaneously, with complexity as a limiting factor. Leads high performing, cross-functional, often globally distributed teams. Works independently, without the need for day-to-day guidance. Serves as a project manager for initiatives within the program. Performs core project management duties, including guiding the project through formal approval and funding gates; developing a project plan that includes a detailed budget, project timeline, detailed task-driven schedule, project RACI and resource plan, and communication plan; and managing project execution from analysis/design through build, test, and deployment. When leading an Agile project, partners closely with the scrum master and product owner on all activities. Ensures that program and project status reports and quarterly updates are relevant, transparent, and add value. Partners with relevant IT and business hiring managers to ensure that the project has the skillsets and the resources required for delivery. Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Minimum of three years’ experience as a senior project manager in Technology or similar setting; must have at least five plus years overall experience working in Technology. Bachelor’s Degree required; Master’s Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Management preferred. PMP, PgMP, and Scrum Master Certifications are a plus. Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities Leadership And Communication Leads by example – with confidence, a positive attitude, patience, honesty and integrity, and a strong sense of commitment. Ability to ‘read the room’, to know what is possible and what is not, and to know how to navigate program and project engagements efficiently and effectively. Ability to engage in difficult conversations that result in positive, actionable outcomes. Ability to navigate complex and diverse landscapes effectively. Seeks and provides honest, transparent feedback. Ability to build and lead high-performing project teams. Ability to set expectations and hold individuals and team members accountable to their commitments. Drives decision-making that favours compromise and alignment over consensus-building. Good facilitation skills; ability to adapt approach to different types of engagements. Good written and verbal communication. Acumen And Learning Agility Deep understanding of technology program and portfolio management practices. Expert-level knowledge of standards and practices for technology project lifecycle management activities and deliverables. Clear understanding of project technical activities, including: (1) solution analysis and design; (2) enterprise, solution, and infrastructure architecture; (3) systems integration; (4) data conversion and migration; (5) environment management and build processes; and (6) deployment planning and execution. Expertise in MS Project (Project Server) and at least one program portfolio management tool, such as MS Project Portfolio Management (PPM). Advanced skills in the MS Office Product Suite, particularly Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Solid understanding of ServiceNow ITSM is strongly desired Experience with Smart Sheets and reporting solutions such as Tableau and PowerBi a strong plus #Transformation All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. Starbucks Corporation is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. jobTitle: real estate manager, Existing Store Portfolio
jobDescription: Now Brewing – real estate manager, Existing Store Portfolio! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. As a real estate manager, Existing Store Portfolio you will… Manages existing store portfolio of 1200-1700 locations. jobTitle: resolution advisor, Customer Care - Seattle, WA
jobDescription: Now Brewing – resolution advisor! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. This job manages escalated incidents by leveraging partners across the enterprise, engaging vendors and consulting with retail leadership to provide end-to-end resolution. Partners in this role serve as a single point of escalation support for our executive & senior leadership teams and defend the brand externally on our social channels. Resolution advisors are expert problem-solvers who exercise best practices in de-escalation that enhance and grow the value of the brand, use forward-thinking solutions and technology to deliver the Starbucks Experience in a timely manner, while analyzing and communicating the root-cause of customer complaints to leadership. The role identifies opportunities in quality with the Customer Contact Centers and retail stores, provides feedback, develops internal and enterprise-wide processes, and continuously stays up-to-date on Starbucks operation standards. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks mission and values. As a resolution advisor, you will… Provides end-to-end investigation to resolve the highest level of customer care issues pertaining to experiences with our brands, including but not limited to: claims of discrimination & harassment, mitigating contacts before they reach Risk or Legal, and personal injury or property damage Consults with all levels of retail leadership (from Store Manager to Senior Vice President – US operations) to advise and make decisions on escalated issues impacting customers and the business Serves as a key stakeholder in cross-functional crisis management Resolves customer issues on behalf of the executive leadership team Creates talking points on escalated customer issues for our owned @StarbucksCare handle and other Starbucks-verified social media channels Crafts messaging for escalated issues to be delivered by retail leadership Uses expertise in multiple systems to research, troubleshoot and provide issue resolution Works cross-functionally with our stakeholders, including but not limited to: Public Affairs, Risk, Legal, Ethics & Compliance, Campaign Managers and PRMs to ensure alignment on processes and communication to customers Manages spend through our fiscal authority and recovery methods to find opportunities to provide cost savings to the organization Analyzes emerging issues and recommends solutions to improve the customer experience and reduce future contacts Advises and participates on project teams and task forces for special projects. Assists with testing and implementing new technologies, products, processes, and programs to ensure operational success Assists in vendor coaching and guidance on behalf of all customer facing Starbucks brands Maintains regular and punctual attendance for normal work hours and on-call afterhours & weekends We’d Love To Hear From People With 3-5 years of retail operations or call center experience 1-2 years leadership experience in retail or office environment or data analysis experience From free coffee to competitive pay, Starbucks is proud to offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package to our eligible part-time and full-time partners. Benefits include 100% tuition coverage through our Starbucks College Achievement Plan, health coverage with a variety of plans to choose from, and stock & savings programs like our equity reward program, Bean Stock. What’s more, Starbucks offers flexible scheduling and opportunities for paid time off. Visit starbucksbenefits.com for details. If you live in the greater Seattle area, we offer a flexible workplace that allows for hybrid work. Partners can work remotely up to four days per week and leverage the office 1-2 days per week, on average. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 206-318-0660 or via email at applicantaccommodation@starbucks.com.

Now Brewing – sanitation partner! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrates coffee and its rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing and supporting partners who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. The Starbucks experience starts in our Roasting Plants where we have a dedicated team of professional roasters and supporting process teams including planning, warehouse management, packaging, roasting, maintenance, engineering and logistics. As a Sanitation Partner, You Will Responsible for detail cleaning of processing equipment including, production utensils, tanks, conveyors, overhead pipes, cooling units, walls, floors, drains, ceiling etc. Must use the 7 steps to effective wet wash during cleaning to maintain Food Safety and Pest Control. Must comply with all company and quality policies and chemical and safety procedures. May be required to assemble and disassemble processing equipment. Work in a timely manner to return production areas and equipment back to production. Responsible for transporting trash and other waste for disposal. Able to communicate problems or concerns with appropriate personnel. Wear all proper protective equipment during sanitation cleaning. Ability to learn equipment systems or use HMI screens to stop, start, and purge equipment. We’d Love To Hear From People With Ability to lift up to 50 lbs. Ability to perform repetitive tasks: stand during most of the shift, walking, stooping, bending, reaching and crouching, climbing up/down stairs and ladders. Ability to use chemicals (soap, sanitizers, acids) safely. Knowledge of sanitation equipment and tools. Knowledge of GMPs, Food Safety and Sanitation Procedures. Ability to read and understand Safety Data Sheets (SDS) and Standard Cleaning Methods. Willing to learn and adhere to proper procedures in safety when working with moving machinery. Willing to accept change and work in a team-based environment. Understand Lock out tag out procedures. May be required to become certified in forklift, scissor lift, boom lift, or electric pallet jack certification. HS Diploma or equivalent Experience in Food Manufacturing a plus Must have good attendance Excellent oral & written communications skills Good planning & organizational skills Ability to make decision / good problem-solving skills Great listening skills and can follow instructions Ability to work in a team environment All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
