Job Summary And Mission This position contributes to the success of Starbucks Android mobile application by developing, implementing, and sustaining test automation, practices, methods, tools and controls in support of the Starbucks Android mobile application development team. The Android SDET lead has complete ownership of the automation needs and works closely with the team developing complex UI, API, CI and environmental systems test automation. The Android SDET Lead will be expected to take a proactive role in setting up and achieving goals and milestones for the team as well as recommending quality improvements to automation requirements, facilitating automation development, effective automation execution and assisting in the development and implementation of new automation technologies and frameworks. This role will have a primary focus on the development and sustainment of automation frameworks from the ground up with minimal usage of 3rd party frameworks, tools, and GUI driven automation tools. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Ownership of the design, development and execution of the Test automation & its processes Develop mobile UI automation using Espresso with Java and Kotlin Develop, maintain and execute automated test scripts Continuously work with leadership to address the overcome the challenges of improving Starbucks’ automation frameworks Work with cross-platform teams to gain efficiencies Develop new automation frameworks, improve existing ones and implement automated test suites and test cases within those frameworks Implement process improvements to automation, development, automation execution and assist in their development and implementation Improve efficiency with CI/CD and Cloud solutions Participate in tool and technology selection processes and create proof of concept models for new technologies Participate in analysis on whether features or functions should be automated. Monitor, consolidate, analyze, debug and communicates automation test results Create and manufacture test data needed for execution or database population Follow coding and design standards and provide suggestions for improvements Participate in the continual maintenance of our code base and refactoring Requirements Strong coding knowledge and experience in Object Oriented development languages (Java, Kotlin, etc.) Experience (5 or more years) developing test automation (unit, functional, integrated or end-to-end) Experienced in applying algorithms and design patterns to solve complex problems Demonstrate knowledge using version control and defect tracking methods, including an understanding of associated tools/software (Github, TestRail, Jira, or similar) Experience/knowledge in CI/CD tools – Jenkins or Bamboo An understanding of project management processes and related tools Experience/familiarity in Agile / Scrum / Kanban / DevOps processes Strong organization and planning skills Ability to handle numerous concurrent activities under time constraints and effectively prioritize and execute assignments in a highly dynamic environment Demonstrated collaboration on diverse teams including products, developers & quality assurance Nice to Have Passion for learning new tools / technologies Experienced in script development in a Linux environment is a plus JavaScript, Groovy, Ruby, or Python development experience is a plus All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. jobTitle: senior application developer, Core Infrastructure Services (Remote, Seattle or Phoenix)
jobDescription: From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. The Core Infrastructure Engineering team’s focus is building massively scalable full stack infrastructure for Starbucks owned, licensed and franchise stores. This role will concentrate on building infrastructure automation leveraging a declarative GitOps approach across multiple infrastructure domains. Help us extend and leverage our capabilities across network, compute, virtualization, and containerized functions. Prior experience with full stack automation, CI/CD, Git, Python, Golang and Kubernetes are vital. Familiarity with cloud native design patterns, edge computing solutions, and API development are highly desirable. If you are driven by innovation, and technical challenges, and want to be a part of some amazing, industry-leading work, join us. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Technical Design and Implementation Develops software solutions to business problems. Leverages established design patterns and coding standards. Builds solutions that are secure, durable, scalable, accessible, and self-healing. Participates in the solution design process: requirements gathering and backlog refinement, shapes, and guides systems approach, helps with project initiation, contributes to functional design and development. Provides transparency in approach and progress. Automates test coverage per platform capabilities and requirements. Establishes and maintains continuous build and integration testing on applicable platforms and assists with manual system and integration testing efforts. Operates in both waterfall and Agile Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) processes and methodologies. Platform Stewardship Partners with cross functional teams, such as Infrastructure, Security, Architecture, QA, and key Development teams, to drive designs and solutions to ensure compliant, secure, and supportable solutions. Deepens vendor relationships to understand and influence vendor product offerings and roadmaps, improves support engagement, and gains insight into technology trends. Production Support for application components Fulfills responsibilities for on call support for the application components. Assists with the creation and reporting of operational Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) on items such as application performance. Creates and maintains documentation supporting training, deployment, and operational processes. Basic Qualifications 7+ years of professional industry experience with software development. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field. Knowledge and experience designing and developing complex software systems. Working understanding of application architecture, infrastructure, security concepts, and technical implementation. Thorough understanding of relevant platform and applications, including established APIs, system activity components, process flows, underlying data models, business logic, and application configuration. 5+ years of experience in Go and/or Python development. Ability to successfully work remotely while balancing multiple priorities and meeting deadlines. Preferred Qualifications Technical Proficiency Aptitude and eagerness to investigate and learn new technologies and trends as they become relevant for the business and our platforms. Ability to write and value high quality, reusable software with minimal defects. Ability to work directly with users to understand, diagnose, and propose solutions to their problems. Domain Proficiency Experience in designing and developing relevant enhancements on top of industry COTS (Commercial Off the Shelf) applications that differentiate and provide competitive advantage. Knowledge of business context and trends, as well as the business customers’ opportunities. Awareness of the functional aspects of the solution. Capable of developing and deploying cloud-native software and infrastructure (AWS or Azure) in an automated fashion. Interpersonal Skills Shows strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Effectively uses facts and data to build support for solutions across teams and stakeholders. Capable of working either independently on tasks or as a collaborative unit as best fits the problem at hand. Ability to negotiate priorities, approach, design and ideas with team members and customers. Join us and be part of something bigger. Apply today! #Transformation All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. jobTitle: senior communications manager, Partner Digital Content (Seattle, WA based)
jobDescription: senior communications manager, partner digital content From the beginning, human connection has been core to Starbucks purpose. We aspire to be a different kind of company, creating a culture of warmth and belonging and deep care for our partners (employees), customers and neighborhoods all over the world. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. For Example, You Will As a Starbucks senior communications manager, you’ll oversee our content and engagement strategy for internal-facing digital channels that reach more than 250,000 Starbucks partners (employees) in our stores, plants and support centers/offices. You’ll drive a best-in-class content strategy that inspires, informs and increases engagement within our partner communities across an ecosystem of internal channels that are in different stages of growth. Define and drive the content strategy for a brand new partner app coming in early 2023 to help us better inform and engage our baristas and shift supervisors in US and Canada stores, with a focus on co-creation and collaboration; Be part of the team leading an upcoming overhaul (and reimagining!) of the company’s primary intranet, the Partner Hub, and supporting the change management plans as we get ready to launch; Collaborating with our partner platform and insights experts to drive and sustain a strategic content strategy for our Workplace platform, which primarily reaches more than 40,000 store managers and HQ/office partners; Driving a strategy, co-created with Retail Operations and our Tryer Innovation Center, on how to best leverage collaboration tools like Springboard to drive greater co-creation with partners Champion the strategy to drive integration with our external-facing partner social channels on Facebook, Instagram and TikTok, our partner channel insights and analytics functions, as well as direct-to-store retail communications channels. In overseeing these internal digital channels and communities, you’ll build a new team and lead partners responsible in content creation and engagement for the channels. Our partners are busier than ever, and we’re looking for someone who understands their needs by segment, can work fast, and lead a team to develop short, engaging content and communications that works for them. With that in mind, you will be responsible for defining the voice, strategy, collaboration and programs across these digital channels – a role that requires strong communication skills, strong digital content expertise including experience in creative storytelling, and seamless cross-functional relationship building and interaction. This includes keeping ahead of digital content trends and dialed-in to the current partner experience. Ideal candidates will have a demonstrated history of managing channel strategy and experience in digital media, as well as experience in fostering and growing a digital community, building and maintaining a rigorous operational process for content development, reviews and approvals. This is an opportunity to lead a dynamic team that is innovating in our approach to digital communications, connections and engagement! As a senior communications manager, Partner Digital Content, you will… Develop and execute the content strategy and calendar for our internal-facing partner digital channels, working closely with campaign leads Oversee a team of content creators on your team, some of whom also support with community management, as well as guiding content creators on other teams who may be supporting your channels, like our creative studio, PRO (human resources), or retail operations. Partner closely with insights/analytics partners to define key measures of success for your channels and provide analysis of results, including strategic and tactical recommendations to improve content and campaign performance Provide counsel to key stakeholders in Partner Communications, Global/Corporate Communications, PRO, Technology, Legal and Operations. We’d Love To Hear From People With 10+ years of communications, content or marketing experience Experience leading channel strategy for digital platforms, including strong knowledge of content creation, digital platform capabilities and online engagement tools Ideally experience in leveraging digital channels and content to create and drive communities with our target audiences, and two-way dialog and collaboration Experienced team leader Understanding of the retail landscape or demonstrated ability to learn fast Ability to decode “corporate speak” and create brief, clear and persuasive content that engages our partners. Energized by working in a fast-paced organization. Excellent communication, organizational, time and self-management skills. Consistent and strong collaborator across teams. Desire to learn from your success, failures and from the experience of others. Natural disposition to work with urgency and limited guidance from your supervisor. Self-driven and ambitious tech-savvy professional Comfortable working with a hybrid team. BA or BS degree in Communications, Marketing or relevant field preferred Join us and be part of something bigger. Apply today! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. jobTitle: senior engineer, Global Packaging Solutions and Innovation
jobDescription: From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not onlycelebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. Your focus will be delivering packaging solutions for the Food and Delivery category. Here at Starbucks, we take a broad and challenging scope of ownership. We are charged with owning and leading in the pursuit of elevating our brands through design, materials and quality. Our fast-paced environment provides the opportunity to independently collaborate with our amazing cross-functional partners. With a highly entrepreneurial spirit, there are no boundaries to what you can accomplish. You will work with our customer marketing & product organization, our sourcing, quality, operations, supply chain & social impact teams on a regular basis. You will truly have an opportunity to impact the direction and position of our business. In the Global Packaging function, we focus on Innovation, Research, Sustainability, New Product Introductions, Cost Savings, and Quality. You will be responsible for driving the agenda of your product category amongst a talented team of engineers. In this role you will need to capitalize on the following: Building strong and personal relationships with partners to influence and drive packaging solutions that drive people, planet and profit corporate results Pro-actively lead and own the technical direction of core food and delivery packaging platform solution initiatives Conduct and own category broad industry trends & opportunities landscape Manage and collaborate with external vendors and technology partners to create leading solutions Design, develop and execute new packaging solutions with customer learning plans, lab technical testing protocols all the way through to tooling and line qualification. Ensure technical rigor is built into our timelines. Proactively manage and communicate risk. Present to multiple levels of functional leadership As a sr. engineer in the Global Packaging Solutions and Innovation team, you will… Lead in the effort to raise the standard for how packaging in your category delivers business results. Cross over multiple packaging categories and flex your technical skills in our high paced and exciting environment Own the technical development of packaging platforms Manage multiple complex projects and deliver on time with quality results We’d Love To Hear From People With 5 years professional engineering experience with consumer product and/or retail packaging. Degrees in Packaging, Mechanical, Materials or Chemical Engineering. Solid understanding of packaging materials, package/product systems, packaging equipment, and packaging performance testing. Sustainable packaging experience a plus Ability to operate independently with guidance. jobTitle: senior manager, Corporate and Financial Communications (Seattle, WA based)
jobDescription: senior manager, corporate communications: Financial Communications/Business Storytelling From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company, creating a culture of warmth and belonging and deep care for coffee farmers and our partners (employees), to our customers and communities all over the world. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. We are looking for a senior manager, corporate communications: Financial Communications/Business Storytelling who will support our best-in-class corporate communications team in orchestrating Starbucks opportunity for growth – playing a critical role in bringing to life compelling strategic narratives that increase the general understanding of Starbucks corporate business and initiatives. The ideal candidate is driven to establish process and organization and is a passionate storyteller across all platforms. Comfort in engaging with media and understanding of external communications platforms is a must. About Us At Starbucks, we believe in balancing profit with purpose and the pursuit of doing well by doing good. With more than 400,000 partners (employees) around the world, we’re on a mission to nurture and inspire the human spirit – one person, one cup and one neighborhood at a time. We have high aspirations for the future and securing the best and the brightest for our stores and support centers is a critical element to achieving our goals. Job Summary And Mission The Senior Network Engineer position engages in network engineering and architecture activities for Starbucks and facilitates network design and planning. The engineer participates in on-call rotation, troubleshoots issues, and applies technical knowledge to resolve complex network incidents escalated from lower tier teams. This role works independently to manage network projects to both build out and lifecycle network infrastructure under limited supervision. Some domestic/international travel (<10%) required This role supports 24/7 customers requiring the engineer to work off-hours and holidays for major implementations. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Research, Design, and Engineering Contributes to long term network architecture planning for specific network services. Contributes to short- and long-term planning to meet network requirements. Facilitates efforts to establish and review network architecture, standards, and best practices for network design and implementation Analyzes capacity issues. Executes regular planned maintenance and testing activities. Ensures network infrastructure is fully compliant with security guidelines Anticipates changes and issues with existing network services to proactively implement solutions before they impact services. Stays abreast of current trends in technology and brings new ideas and their application to the Starbucks network to the attention of the team. Professional Development Attends professional conferences and seminars. Presents technical briefings. Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations. Monitoring and Analysis Monitor network usage, anticipate problems, and suggest solution. Identifies issues with network management tools. Analyzes network activity and network problems to discover and prevent systematic errors. Reporting network operational status by gathering and prioritizing data Incident Escalation and Troubleshooting Gather and interpret data for contribution to root cause investigation of outages. Provide Tier III escalation support of network service incidents to diagnose problems and resolve time-critical issues Documentation Documents architectures, processes, as-builts, projects, standards, and root cause analyses both in text and diagram form. Contributes to the formulation and implementation of installation standards and procedures. Projects Manages projects under supervision. Subject Matter Expertise Demonstrates deep dive knowledge of lan/wan networking Programming Effectively uses scripts for network operations Summary Of Experience 6+ years of relevant network engineering experience Basic Qualifications General Full-time experience with medium to large scale enterprise networks including campus and data centers (5 yrs) Experience delivering high quality network products to internal and external customers (5 yrs) Routing and Switching Experience with switches and routers. (5+ yrs) Experience with TCP/IP, routing/switching concepts, and common routing protocols. Security Service Technology Firewall experience including TCP/IP filtering, NAT, and state full inspection, Palo Alto preferred (3+ yrs) IPAM DNS and DHCP administration (3+ yrs) Virtualization and Server Platform Some familiarity with server, storage virtualization, i.e. MDS switching infrastructure, VSAN, VRF, VPN, and VMWare vSphere. (1yrs) Software Development Creation of scripts for network operations using shell scripts, Python, or other means. (3+ yrs) Network Management and Monitoring Tools Network management tools (3+ yrs) Education and Certification Bachelors degree in computer science, electrical and computer engineering, or equivalent military/civilian experience in network systems and technology CCNP level certification or equivalent experience and demonstrated skills Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Problem Solving and Network Troubleshooting Ability to apply both critical and systematic thinking to network incident resolution and root cause investigation Routing and Switching Knowledge proficiency with CLI and GUI based configuration of multi-vendor routers, switches and firewalls Knowledge and proficiency with EOS, IOS, BGP, GRE, and OSPF. Knowledge and proficiency with WAN technologies including MPLS, circuiting, and commodity peering, IPSEC, hub and spoke SD-WAN. Knowledge and proficiency with 802.11 WiFi in complex RF environments. Private LTE experience a plus. Network performance Tuning Able to discern and correlate data from network instrumentation. Network Design and Implementation Able to design and implement networks meeting the needs of customers and projects. Network Hardware Configuration Able to configure network hardware based on templates and networking best practices. Communication Verbal and written skills reflecting an ability to express oneself clearly and articulately. Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences Interpersonal Skills Ability to employ patience and empathy while dealing with conflict or differing viewpoints All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. jobTitle: senior software engineer - Starbucks Technology(Seattle OR Remote)
jobDescription: At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks Technologists work to achieve this mission through the use of cutting-edge technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities. At our core, we believe technology is a key enabler for growth and is required for business success in the future. We believe Starbucks must advance its technology resources and think long term to innovate and deliver maximum value for our partners, customers and shareholders. We believe it takes collaboration and partnership to deliver results and we will work across the company to enable sustainable business capabilities- not just fulfill immediate needs. If you’ve got what it takes to help transform one of the most iconic brands in the world into a lean, efficient and highly automated platform, we’d like to talk to you. Summary Of Key Responsibilities As a Senior Software Engineer, you will develop and support Starbucks Retail Technology products by collaboratively identifying, designing, developing and deploying software to deliver retail and digital commerce systems that fulfill strategic initiatives and operational improvements. This is a technical role that requires deep software development expertise, domain proficiency and platform depth. Typical daily activities include requirements analysis, solution design and, most of all, software development. An effective Senior Software engineer contributes relevant technical, functional, and process expertise to the team. A successful candidate is proficient with data structures and algorithms with mastery of one or more general purpose programming languages, tools and frameworks. Some Key Responsibilities For This Role Are The Following Experience coding using Agile and DevOps engineering practices Ability to provide expertise and leadership in translating complex business requirements to functional, non-functional and technical designs, adopts designs that prioritize user experience and extensibility to mobile application use, and addresses quality issues by asking questions and stating assumptions to mitigate gaps in developer understanding. Expertise in established design patterns, contributes to new design patterns for platform, and ability to negotiate and communicate designs by facilitating and socializing ideas through technical specification documentation. Ability to lead remediation efforts for recurring issue and can direct the team's best practices for incident resolution and the facilitation of cross functional troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and engagement with vendors where needed. The capability of initiating, organizing and being the champion of complex, development efforts; supervises delivery of other engineers on the team, setting priority, providing guidance, and feedback on deliverables and partnering with vendors to improve delivery model and ensure success. Ability to represent the engineering team when engaging with cross functional teams, including functional analysts, Project Management, Development, Architecture, Security, Infrastructure and the business customer. Negotiates, facilitates, and influences others to gain alignment and mutually agreeable outcomes in complex and ambiguous situations. Experience mentoring less experienced engineers in a technical, business, or soft skills capacity. Experience, Skills And Knowledge Proven experience building, sustaining and optimizing large-scale distributed enterprise systems at web scale, services-oriented front-end and back-end design Hands-on Development, Deployment and Sustainment of cloud-first applications (Azure or AWS) using Service Fabric or Azure Kubernetes service, CosmosDB, Service Bus/EventHub Hands-on experience with Service-Oriented, Microservices architectures, designs and applications Experience in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems Proven experience with message-oriented applications in a high-transaction online commerce business applications or equivalent high Transaction-Per-Second technical requirement environment Proven experience with Microsoft .NET Framework, C#, Java, Python or Scala programming language Demonstrated ability to debug and optimize code and automate routine tasks Deep knowledge in application development and supporting production environments and teams Experience with other cloud platforms such as Amazon AWS are a plus Experience implementing and managing high capacity, redundant, and mission critical environments Comfortable with development and support of database-centric applications is a plus Experience in server operations, system administration, network configuration and systems engineering Proficiency in TCP/IP based applications where networking architecture and core infrastructure technologies are critical. For example, applications that have security, crypto, key and certificate authentication & authorization, certificate management and rotation, SAML or other security protocols and technologies is a plus Experience as a member of teams that support 24x7 production environments Required Qualifications 7+ years of professional industry experience with software development 4+ years of progressive engineering experience in building cloud (Azure/AWS) first applications. jobTitle: senior systems analyst- Digital Partner Application
jobDescription: Job Summary And Mission At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks Technologists work to achieve this mission using innovative technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities. As a systems analyst senior, you work to archive this mission by leading, managing, and coaching a team of technologists responsible for the evolution of the digital partner application (“Partner App”) that is leveraged by all 300,00+ partners (workers) across 10,000+ locations in the United States and Canada. The digital partner application drives partner engagement and satisfaction by offering a single application to access essential perks & benefits, shift & schedule, communities, and communication information. We're looking for analysts who are experienced in supporting systems development lifecycle for our new digital workforce engagement system and who aspire to make a bigger impact by growing their talent in cloud technologies, mobile application delivery, data modeling and data management areas. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Solution Design Gathers, analyzes, and documents solution requirements. Facilitates user story creation and backlog grooming in an agile delivery environment. Participate in all aspects of the software development process including, requirements gathering, designing, coding, unit testing, quality assurance, and deployment documentation. Understands working of digital workforce engagement systems; data in-flow, out-flow and conducts deep-dive investigations into business problems and identify potential opportunities. Assist in standardization and implementation of best practices in requirement management, process flows, data flows and configurations, etc. Ability to work in a deadline-driven work environment; ability to re-prioritize on a regular basis to remain current with business needs. Coordinates with business, development, and testing teams and leverages relevant process and technology proficiency to propose optimal solution(s) options delivering required business capabilities. Proactively identifies and effectively assesses improvement opportunities (productivity/efficiency gains, cost savings, etc.). Utilizes agile delivery methodologies and participates on scrum teams in the execution of solution delivery projects. Considers overall user technology experience in thoughtfully designing engaging solutions. System Configuration & Testing Performs application configuration (i.e., create attributes, workflows and UI changes) in support of solution delivery initiatives. Partners with development teams in agile design/development of custom solution components. Performs code reviews as required. Defines and develops approaches for data conversion. Performs the extract, load, and validation of converted data. Supports solution testing efforts by developing test plans, preparing test environments, performing test execution, and validating test results. Production Support Participates in production support for critical systems that includes pager responsibilities on-call rotation (24*7). Update and maintain necessary documentation related to design changes, code, deployment, and supportability. Coordinates issue resolution with vendors and/or cross-functional teams. Provides timely and thorough communication regarding issue status/resolution with end-users and other key stakeholders. Develops and facilitates system training. Leadership Taking responsibility for estimating, planning, and managing all his/her own tasks and reporting on progress. Self-directed; is successful with minimal direction and provides guidance and support to consultants and less senior analysts Provides constructive input and perspective to team conversations Effectively facilitates/negotiates through challenging situations Generates new ideas and influences decisions within and outside team. Demonstrates knowledge of industry trends and innovative thought leadership. Interfaces across organization levels comfortably with internal business customers, cross-functional technical peers, and external business partners, demonstrating a strong sense of ownership. Basic Qualifications Summary of Experience Bachelor’s degree in Applied Computer Science, Computer Applications, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field, plus 7+ years of post-bachelor’s and progressive experience in a related systems analyst role Experience working on all facets of system development lifecycle supporting and interfacing with systems. (7+ years) Must have hands-on system configuration experience (SaaS) in support of solution delivery initiatives. (5+years) Experienced in the utilization of user-centric design concepts in conjunction with agile prototyping (5+ years). Strong knowledge of Agile SCRUM solution design/development methodology and practices (4+ years). Required knowledge of SQL and one or more of DB’s - Oracle, MySQL, Teradata etc.; adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings (5+ years) Must have experience utilizing user-centric design concepts in conjunction with agile development and testing processes to support the development of highly engaging technology solutions (5+ years) Experience in data analysis using open-source solutions such as: Spark, data bricks, Elastic Search is a plus (5+years) Experience in building Insights from data - associations among data, business rules/logics, data flows, data usages is a plus Excellent verbal and written communication and persuasion skills Capacity to stay organized while managing competing priorities. Ability to thoroughly understand complex business and technical issues and influence decision-making. Preferred Qualifications Retail industry experiences in a technology environment with a demonstrable record of successfully delivering complex digital solutions and products (5+ years). Demonstrated experience with configuring, and managing digital workforce engagement platforms (e.g., Workjam, Boomr, Workday, OnShift, Shyft) for a QSR (Quick Service Restaurants) retailer (4+ years). Demonstrated experience managing and/or integrating with workforce management platforms (e.g., JDA/BlueYonder, Kronos, Workday) for a QSR retailer (4+ years). jobTitle: senior technical product manager- Distribution Technology
jobDescription: Job Summary And Mission At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks Technologists work to achieve this mission through the use of cutting-edge technology delivered to our partners, customers, stores, roasters, and global communities. The Distribution Technology team is looking for a tpm sr, with a product and growth mindset, excellent communications skills and customer service, and the ability to lead others. Our team is responsible for the tools, capabilities, and processes for Order Fulfillment and the Last Mile Delivery to our stores and customers. Our goal is to deliver user friendly, innovative, and data driven technology solutions and insights to enable new opportunities and drive efficiencies in distribution and warehouse operation. In this role, the tpm sr will be responsible for the products for Distribution Technology, working with business and technical teams, to create the roadmap and define, prioritize, and deliver technology solutions that align with the strategic vision, delight our customers, and are data driven and KPI oriented. To be successful, the tpm sr should be an expert in managing complex and ambiguous initiatives while managing cross functional expectations. They need to have a continuous improvement mindset to continually design, develop, and deploy enhanced capabilities with a focus on elevating the user experience. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Product Strategy and Roadmap Creates technical product vision and plan in partnership with stakeholders, engineering, and architecture teams Manages product planning and development through day to day collaboration and decision making with a cross-functional team including architects, developers, designers and business or subject matter representatives Ensures the technical product evolution is aligned to ST strategic direction Shapes a balanced, prioritized backlog that reflects business goals, technology innovation, and tech optimization Aligns solution design and delivery with roadmaps of cross-functional teams Participates in demos and creation of RFIs/RFPs for vendor solutions Manages the Product Roadmap, contributes to project charters, project initiation, solution design reviews, cross-functional MDF’s Bridges the gap between Architecture and Solution Delivery Stays abreast of new technology capabilities and leverages knowledge in contributing to product solutions. Recommends and plans innovative products and features. Product Delivery Translates customer experience into technical requirements and product solutions Drives technical solution for large features/technically complex features independently. Creates data flows and functional and technical specifications as needed Responsible for defining the acceptance criteria of a product feature Responsible for documentation of requirements, and acceptance criteria per process, provides guidance to others in working team Works with producers, engineering and QA to align on feature sizing and delivery planning Ensures engineering team has needed information on endpoints, inputs and outputs Helps resolve technical blocking issues and coordinates solutions across multiple technical teams Performs validation of feature against customer and business goals and acceptance criteria Determines technical feasibility, dependencies and constraints of features with support from neighboring technology teams as needed. Identifies technical tradeoffs, escalates risks and manages mitigation in collaboration with neighbor ST teams Cross-functional Relationships and Communications Acts as a coach/mentor to team on various technical product manager competencies Works with engineering to define technical solution for experiment definition Works with product managers to scope and prioritize upcoming projects into the roadmap Builds effective relationships with key internal engineering, product and design teams Communicates effectively with technology and business teams independently, drives consistency in business communications Influences & negotiates w/ teams across ST, business partners, 3rd party vendors on issues/projects of all sizes; typically able to resolve issues without escalation Influences/supports new ideas and decisions; armed within a known skill-set/competency/tool Direct interaction with business stakeholders; understands business and technical issues; influences decision making; translates technical approach for feature delivery; drives to eliminate ambiguity in feature criteria and goals; presents solution options/recommendations clearly and persuasively to support business stakeholder decisions Performance and Metrics Defines product performance and effectiveness metrics that measure and benchmark product success. Monitors feature performance to find opportunitites to address continuous improvement. Drives optimization and process improvements between product, design, and development teams Understands the customer’s objectives and KPI’s, and supports with data driven and KPI oriented solutions Summary Of Experience Hands on experience in developing technical roadmaps, story outlines, writing user stories, refining product backlogs and coordinating/prioritizing conflicting requirements in a fast-paced, changing environment Detail- and results-oriented, able to analyze data to justify product decisions and apply key learnings. Ability to thoroughly understand complex business and technical issues and influence decision making Is technically adept on end-to-end system architecture Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities Strong verbal and written communications skills Consistently uses communications skills to influence outcomes Ability to influence others without authority to get things done in a timely fashion Ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines Strong knowledge of agile development practices, methodologies and tools Technical knowledge in web and mobile applications preferred Qualifications 7+ years of industry experience in a technology environment with a record of successfully delivering complex products Recent experience in building applications for web and/or mobile Ability to read and understand programming languages Strong verbal and written communications skills, ability to quickly master new systems and/or processes, capacity to stay organized while managing competing priorities Prior programming experience a plus All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Shift Supervisor Job Summary and Mission This job contributes to Starbucks success by assisting the store manager in executing store operations during scheduled shifts. This job deploys partners and delegates tasks so that partners can create and maintain the Starbucks Experience for our customers. The incumbent is responsible for modeling and acting in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. Summary of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:  Acts with integrity, honesty and knowledge that promote the culture, values and mission of Starbucks. Maintains a calm demeanor during periods of high volume or unusual events to keep store operating to standard and to set a positive example for the shift team.  Anticipates customer and store needs by constantly evaluating environment and customers for cues. Communicates information to manager so that the team can respond as necessary to create the Third Place environment during each shift.  Assists with new partner training by positively reinforcing successful performance and giving respectful and encouraging coaching as needed. Provides feedback to store manager on partner performance during shift.  Contributes to positive team environment by recognizing alarms or changes in partner morale and performance and communicating them to the store manager .  Creates a positive learning environment by providing clear, specific, timely and respectful coaching and feedback to partners on shift to ensure operational excellence and to improve partner performance.  Delivers legendary customer service to all customers by acting with a customer comes first attitude and connecting with the customer. Discovers and responds to customer needs .  Develops positive relationships with shift team by understanding and addressing individual motivation, needs and concerns.  Executes store operations during scheduled shifts. Organizes opening and closing duties as assigned.  Follows Starbucks operational policies and procedures, including those for cash handling and safety and security, to ensure the safety of all partners during each shift.  Follows all cash management and cash register policies and ensures proper cash management practices are followed by shift team.  Follows up with baristas during the shift to ensure the delivery of legendary customer service for all customers.  Maintains regular and consistent attendance and punctuality.  Provides quality beverages, whole bean, and food products consistently for all customers by adhering to all recipe and presentation standards. Follows health, safety and sanitation guidelines for all products. Summary of Experience Customer service experience in a retail or restaurant environment Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities  Ability to direct the work of others  Ability to learn quickly  Effective oral communication skills  Knowledge of the retail environment  Strong interpersonal skills  Ability to work as part of a team  Ability to build relationships Core Compentencies Puts the customer first Has a relentless focus on the customer. Understands what the customer wants and how to best deliver the experience. Works well with others Listens and communicates well with others within and outside of Starbucks. Creates a team environment that is positive and productive. Leads courageously Takes personal responsibility to do the right thing, and persists in times of challenge or uncertainty. Adapts quickly to change and makes timely, thoughtful decisions. Develops continuously Continuously seek opportunities to improve self and others. Leads with trust, honesty and commitment to hire, coach and develop partners to achieve their potential. Achieves results Understands what drives overall business success and is accountable to prioritize and deliver quality results. Demonstrates knowledge of core products and processes to get results. Anticipates obstacles and takes action to prevent or minimize their impact.

Job Summary & Mission We are seeking a full time QA II Analyst to join our mobile QA team within the Customer Experience Engineering organization in Starbucks. Our mobile apps are used every day by millions of Starbucks customers to order drinks, reload their Starbucks card, buy digital gift cards, and manage their Starbucks rewards account. The Customer Experience Engineering org is in the forefront of the Starbucks digital platform and as a core member of the team, you will maintain a high bar for quality on our iOS and Android mobile apps. You will own major features and will work closely with different disciplines across the organization from planning to release. This role requires a strong, self-driven team player who is passionate about software quality assurance and has experience in mobile app testing, Agile testing capabilities, experience with Accessibility testing, knowledge of UI automation, and excellent communication skills. Primary Daily Responsibilities Writing test plans for new features and supporting existing features during updates and redesigns Executing regression test cases for the monthly releases using beta release candidates Owning features through planning, implementation, and delivery Collaborating daily with, but not limited to QA, Product Managers, Product Design, Engineers, Backend Engineers, and API team. Summary Of Experience 3+ years’ experience in Quality assurance and testing. Demonstrated collaboration on project teams and interaction with project managers, business and functional analysts, developers and the business community directly related to quality assurance responsibilities and roles. (3 years) Experience with reading, interpreting, and reviewing code is preferred but not required. Demonstrate test management processes and technical skills, including an understanding of manual and automated test execution and performance related tools. (3 years) Demonstrate knowledge using version control and defect tracking methods, including an understanding of associated tools. (3 years) Knowledge of application software development life cycle concepts, lean and agile best practices, environment and configuration management, as well as test management methodologies and practices. (3 years) Knowledge of HTTP Proxy applications: Charles/Fiddler Experience testing on iOS or Android (2-3 Years) having both is a plus Experience working in an Agile environment is a plus Experience with Android Studio or xCode (1- 3) Experience using ADB / Logcat/StackTrace ,etc. Experience with Jira is a plus Experience with TestRail is a plus Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Outstanding organization and planning skills Exceptional communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing Excellent facilitation and presentation skills Excellent risk mitigation and process improvement skills Sensitivity and collaborative relationship-based awareness working with project sponsors and stakeholders Strong attention to detail Motivation to improve the app experience beyond what is outlined in the spec Product intuition and user empathy Exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities Technical systems knowledge for various applications and systems Ability to manage numerous concurrent projects, activities, and tasks under time constraints Team player who exhibits effective interpersonal skills with a collaborative style A demonstrated track record of maintaining and improving individual as well as team job skills through training, self-research and self-study Ability to interpret and understand the architecture and infrastructure of systems Core Competencies Puts the Customer First: Has a relentless focus on the customer. Understands what the customer wants and how to best deliver the experience. Works Well with Others: Listens and communicates well with others within and outside of Starbucks. Creates a team environment that is positive and productive. Leads Courageously: Takes personal responsibility to do the right thing and persists in times of challenge or uncertainty. Adapts quickly to change and makes timely, thoughtful decisions. Develops Continuously: Continuously seek opportunities to improve self and others. Leads with trust, honesty, and commitment to hire, coach, and develop partners to achieve their potential. jobTitle: sr android engineer, Seattle OR REMOTE
jobDescription: Job Summary And Mission The Starbucks Android application is used by millions of users every month and the Android engineering team is growing and innovating quickly to deliver the best possible and inclusive experience to our users. Come join the Starbucks Android engineering team and help evolve mobile engineering at one of the world's most successful digital rewards and loyalty platforms. If you are driven by innovation, purpose-driven work, technical challenges and want to be a part of some amazing, industry-leading work come join us. As a senior engineer on the team, you will be responsible for driving successful delivery of your work, utilizing your passion and in-depth knowledge of Android accessibility to improve client components, identifying then subsequently helping to drive efforts to mature team practices and improve the native digital platform. This role requires an effective technical collaborator who has core Android development expertise and has built and deployed apps to the Google Play Store. As a senior engineer, you will participate in assessing new projects and features for feasibility, writing code for the latest features and important bug fixes, championing accessibility, and working to test and release those features to the public. Responsibilities Build, iterate, and enhance the Starbucks Android application Champion accessibility Contribute to the ongoing improvement of architecture and code reviews Optimize existing code for maintainability and testability Improve app quality with the development of unit and automated UI tests Mature and evolve team testing practice and philosophy Participate in vision and strategy exercises for the team About You You approach challenges and problems with a positive solution-oriented mindset. You can react swiftly to changing requirements and develop and explore alternative solutions You have a proven ability to learn new technologies relatively quickly and apply the gained knowledge to address customer and business problems You have a passion for Android, and you are up to speed on the latest trends and developments A strong passion for learning and adapting to new technologies Technical Requirements Extensive software engineering experience with the Android platform 4+ years of professional experience developing consumer-facing Android mobile applications 5+ years of software development experience Strong experience in integrating RESTful APIs, GraphQL, push notifications and multi-threaded application The pay range for this position may be narrower than that displayed, depending on where the work is performed. div>

jobTitle: Sr. Design Engineer, Industrial Design - Global Growth & Concepts - Seattle, WA
jobDescription: Sr. Design Engineer, Starbucks Global Growth & Concepts Now Brewing – Innovation! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. As a Sr. Design Engineer on the Industrial Design team at Starbucks, you will play a critical role in defining the future store experience for our partners and customers alike, helping drive our goals to be a people, planet and profit positive company. As part of the Global Growth and Concepts organization, our work influences Store Design, Equipment Engineering, Beverage & Food Categories, Store Technology, Marketing, and Operations to ensure each touchpoint in the Starbucks experience delivers on our brand promise. As a member of the industrial design team, you are an avid practitioner of human centered design with a strong belief that collaboration and co-creation are central to delivering successful solutions and essential to a holistic design approach. Your curiosity, passion, skills and talent lead you to see opportunities rather than constraints, and create functional, delightful and responsible solutions to challenging problems. You’re looking for a company that enables you to pursue your interests across functions, and where a job title is not the final definition of who you are, but rather the start of a journey. As a Sr. Design Engineer, you will be primarily based in the Seattle Support Center and focused on: Technical Design Transform conceptual sketches and loose ideas into technical drawings and 3D digital models with expertise in designing for fabrication Revise and update 2D/3D files to maintain accurate archive Physical Prototyping Responsible for creating low to medium fidelity prototypes to inform tools, equipment, and station designs with focus on form, function, and user interaction. Manage sourcing of high-fidelity 3D printing and machined fabrication through our internal Tryer innovation facility. Manage external sourcing of high-fidelity appearance models (domestic and overseas). Test and evaluate prototypes with store partners generating effective insight Virtual Prototyping Integrate virtual 3D augmentation into prototyping process Create digital renderings and assets for visualization as needed Design Team Support Maintain and facilitate an organized, clean, and inviting team lab space Procure supplies, materials, and components in support of team exploration Shared team responsibilities in project management and coordination Proactively progress projects forward through ambiguity, inspiring exploration and innovation Promote environmentally sustainable solutions and practices We’d Love To Hear From People With 5+ years of professional design or engineering experience with a proven portfolio of product innovation and development Demonstrated expertise in prototyping/fabrication/3D printing Deep proficiency in SolidWorks and CAD/CAM software. Additional experience with SketchUp and Keyshot preferred. Practitioner and advocate of design thinking and human centered design Local connections and broad network of supplier resources Join us and be part of something bigger. Apply today! We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. As a senior financial analyst on the North America Retail team, you will contribute to Starbucks success by partnering with business unit finance teams throughout the reporting process to drive monthly and quarterly reporting packages, including materials for the board and executive leaders. NA FP&A is looking for a partner who is analytically strong, adept at building relationships, and can condense large amounts of information into a clear and succinct story. To accomplish this, the ideal candidate will have strong story-telling and analytical abilities, demonstrated cross-functional collaboration, and the ability to influence peers and leaders in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. As a senior financial analyst supporting the North America business, you will… Consolidate and own the company-wide story for our monthly and quarterly financial results, including crafting business memos to the board and executive leaders. Collaborate cross-functionally with business unit finance teams to identify, consolidate, and communicate key drivers, trends, and issues affecting different areas of the business. Prepare total company reporting against forecast, plan, and prior year, as well as provide and explain financial results effectively to all levels of management. Be able to flex between high-level or detailed explanations as needed. Support the consolidation of operating margin analyses for our quarterly earnings release. Implement ideas to improve upon our existing reporting and processes affecting consolidation, earnings guidance, and financial reporting. Build financial models and perform ad hoc analysis in support of our executive leaders and key business customers. We’d Love To Hear From People With Bachelor’s degree or 4 or more years of US military experience Performing financial analysis job functions, including budgeting, forecasting, planning and financial reporting (5+ years) Using electronic financial modeling skills (2+ years) Presenting financial analysis and recommendations to a business unit leader (3+ years) Required Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing Advanced Excel and financial modeling skills Strong attention to detail Ability to work both independently and as part of a team Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships Ability to set priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced and changing environment Working knowledge of Essbase / Hyperion preferred Join us and be part of something bigger. Apply today! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. jobTitle: sr financial analyst, US Retail COGS Finance
jobDescription: Now Brewing – senior financial analyst, US Retail COGS #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. As a senior financial analyst on North America FP&A team, you facilitate the development of strategic and operating plans for cost of goods sold. This position works cross functionally with Global Supply Chain, Inventory Accounting, Product and other teams across the organization. As a senior financial analyst, you will… Lead the development of the US Retail COGS annual operating budget and quarterly forecasts. Establish timelines, partner with cross functional stakeholders, manage consolidation and initiate timely reviews of the financial projections to ensure plans are delivered on time and are consistent with overall company plans. Identify and communicate risks and opportunities. Conduct decision analyses as needed and communicates results. Perform due diligence for new initiatives. Perform sensitivity and incremental cost/benefit decision analyses. Build financial models and provide analytical support for business initiatives. Identify, analyze, and communicate trends and issues affecting the business. Analyze and provide feedback on monthly financial results and key performance measures. Prepare management reports against forecast, budget, and prior year. Provide root cause variance explanations and highlights opportunities and risks. Identify trends, communicate observations, and provide recommendations for cost and margin improvements. Provide financial information and guidance effectively to all levels of management. Establish and facilitate process development and perform on-going review of planning and reporting process to evaluate effectiveness and making recommendations for improvements. jobTitle: sr quality engineer- ST, Seattle OR Remote
jobDescription: Job Summary And Mission At Starbucks, our mission is to inspire and nurture the human spirit – one person, one cup, and one neighborhood at a time. Starbucks Technologists empower and inspire our partners to deliver a consistent and uniquely Starbucks experience anywhere across the globe. This Senior Quality Engineer contributes to Starbucks success by delivering high-quality, reliable, and stable technologies and security capabilities in support of the Starbucks Engineering Platform. This is an opportunity with the Unified Commerce team where you will help with the implementation and launching of key product features that power Starbucks’ Mobile Order and Pay experience. On the Commerce team, you will develop and sustain automated test processes, practices, methods, tools, and controls in support of application and system requirement, development, and test activities throughout the software lifecycles. You will recommend improvements to automation requirements, development, and execution. You will work with analysts, developers and testers in the creation and implementation of test automation processes, methods, and tools. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following: Creates and improves automation framework design features and implements automated test suites and test cases within that framework. Provides design recommendations and mentor junior team members. Recommends quality improvements to automation requirements, design, build, and execution, and then assists in the development and implementation of enhancements. Participates in tool analysis, creates proof of concept models, and makes recommendations to support the tools selection process. Establishes the criteria and participates in evaluation on whether features and functions will be automated. Assist directly and indirectly in the continual hiring and development of early-in-career technical talent. Provides oversight to quality assurance analysts and engineers, developers, and testers on test automation and performance test activities, and then accurately monitors and communicates test execution results. Manufactures test data needed for execution or database population. Follows coding and design standards and provides suggestions on improvements and facilitates with test architecture design. Participates in the continual maintenance of code base and refactoring. Create and execute appropriate test plans, test strategies, and processes for development activities in concert with business and project management efforts. Basic Qualifications 5+ years of professional industry experience with software development. Bachelor’s degree in a software engineering-related field, or commensurate experience. Desired Skills Strong working knowledge to design and develop test automation scripts/framework with Python and Object-Oriented Programming. Strong working knowledge of SQL and No-SQL persistence approaches. Team player who exhibits effective interpersonal skills with a collaborative style. Ability to handle numerous concurrent activities under time constraints and effectively prioritize and execute assignments in a highly dynamic environment. Demonstrated success working within an Agile development environment. Demonstrated collaboration on diverse teams including project managers, business and systems analysts, technicians and developers related to quality assurance roles and responsibilities. Ability to improve individual job skills through training, self-research, and self-study. Knowledge of application software development life cycle concepts, lean and agile best practices, environment and configuration management, test management methodologies and processes. Knowledge of testing best practices and approaches for custom developed and consumer off-the-shelf packaged applications. Experience developing or working with commercial or open-source automation tools and frameworks. Demonstrate knowledge using version control and defect tracking methods, including an understanding of associated tools. Experience with quality assurance testing related to release management. General understanding of application and system architecture concepts including service-oriented architecture (SOA), RESTful APIs and microservices with public cloud platform is a plus. Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes. Knowledge of mobile digital technologies related to testing. The pay range for this position may be narrower than that displayed, depending on where the work is performed. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We are committed to creating a diverse and welcoming workplace that includes partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We believe that enables us to better meet our mission and values while serving customers throughout our global communities. People of color, women, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with all federal state and local ordinances. jobTitle: sr. site reliability engineer - Starbucks Technology (Seattle OR Remote)
jobDescription: Job Summary And Mission If you’ve got what it takes to help transform one of the most iconic brands in the world into a lean, efficient and highly automated platform, we’d like to talk to you. As a Sr. Site Reliability Engineer – Starbucks Technology, you will be responsible for engineering solutions to address day-to-day maintenance, administration, and reliability of Internet-based enterprise systems. On an on-going basis, this position will identify root causes of operational issues in order to resolve them. As required, this position will help engineering teams improve quality, reduce time to market, and make web applications faster and more reliable. This role requires your A-Game: deep technical proficiency in both enterprise-scale systems as well as next gen cloud native applications are required. So, if you believe, like we do, that a cup of coffee can change a life and change our world, come check us out and help us deliver that same amazing experience to our customers around the globe. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. Summary Of Key Responsibilities Automate repetitive tasks (Eliminate toil) Seek opportunities and implement solutions to improve site reliability (reducing Mean Time to Diagnosis, Mean Time to Resolution, System Self-healing, etc.) Participate in On-Call production support Support Software Releases (CI/CD pipeline support, infrastructure, automation, process improvement.) Vulnerability Management (Patching systems and implementing security controls in compliance with Starbucks Global Security) Create and maintain systems and infrastructure documentation Plan and execute on prioritized project tasks Provide technical guidance and training to junior team members Summary Of Experience Coding and Operations experience (8+ years combined) Designing, supporting and deploying mission critical products or services (5+ years) Operating complex, large-scale Enterprise guest-facing Applications or web sites (5+ years) Deploying containerized workloads into Kubernetes (3+ years) Public cloud experience such as Azure, AWS, GCP (5+ years) Writing and maintaining Configuration as Code (5+ years) Worked in an environment that implemented Agile or LEAN principals (5+ years) Basic Qualifications 4-8 years of professional industry experience with software engineering 3-5 years of software engineering and design at high volume or large scale Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related field. Preferred Qualifications Aptitude to pick up new technologies and trends. Experience with a variety of build, deployment, and CI tools such as Jenkins, Webpack, Ansible, Puppet, Github and Octopus Deploy. Experience automating deployments with Github. Experience in designing, implementing and managing Kubernetes. Experience in writing, debugging, and maintaining Helm Charts. Experience with Docker and have experience in establishing container image repositories, building Docker files, container images, and using Docker in establishing continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) deployment pipelines. Experience with tools enabling automated testing and integration. Expertise in Linux and Windows system installation, configuration, administration, troubleshooting, performance tuning, preventative maintenance, capacity planning, monitoring, and security procedures. Experience installing and configuring Azure services using Terraform. Experience in at least two relevant scripting or programming languages (Go, Python, Ruby, Perl, Shell, PowerShell, etc.) Experience hardening and maintaining secure systems (Safe Harbor or PCI experience a plus!) Proven ability to participate with other functional teams in systems integration and design including writing operational specifications, test plans and requirements management with attention to detail Ability to produce system documentation, including writing requirements, operational specifications, system architecture, test plans and as-built documentation, all with attention to detail Ability to build strong relationships and influence others across the organization Demonstrated knowledge of Agile/Lean methodologies Experience working with ITIL and Service Management best practices is a plus '>

jobTitle: sr supply chain planner, Green Coffee
jobDescription: Now Brewing – Senior Supply Chain Planner, Green Coffee! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. As a Senior Green Coffee Planner, the partner will not only have the responsibility to execute supply planning functions for green coffee globally but will also have the opportunity to lead collaboration with the cross-functional teams like SCTC (green coffee trading), Green Coffee Quality, Green Coffee Operations, Finance etc. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is looking to grow and aspires to be a supply chain leader. In addition to the green coffee teams, the partner will also work upstream and downstream with various business that includes our retail partners, CPG, international regions (Asia, EMEA and Latin America) and with manufacturing partners. We will be looking to the green coffee planners to help us build and maintain roadmap for green coffee planning strategies. Now Brewing – store design manager! #tobeapartner From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others. This job contributes to Starbucks success by producing outstanding store designs for a regional market that upholds the Starbucks Customer Experience meeting cost, schedule and operational requirements by working with a cross functional team. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles. As a store design manager, you will… Leadership - Setting goals for the work group, developing organizational capability, and modeling how we work together: Executes Design strategy in design of Starbucks stores. Provides clear, effective and timely communication of design direction and changes to consultants. Identifies exceptions, proposes design solutions and resolves issues with Sr Design Manager. Identifies and communicates key responsibilities and practices to ensure the immediate team of direct reports promotes a successful attitude, confidence in leadership, and teamwork to achieve business results. Supports the implementation of company programs to ensure the success of the Company. Planning and Execution - Developing strategic and operational plans for the work group, managing execution, and measuring results: Contributes to Store Development Business Goals with Construction & Real Estate by achieving target deliverables on number of stores. Designs stores within parameters of individual store budgets and market requirements with alignment from Construction and Real Estate based on direction from the Sr design manager. Plans and manages business unit/department processes and practices to ensure that programs are aligned with company business goals and objectives. Prepares, communicates and educates client groups and team on changes in policies and practices within the organization. Sets schedules with alignment from Construction and Real Estate. Communicates dates to team and meets all established deadlines. Business Requirements - Providing functional expertise and executing functional responsibilities: Ensures alignment across cross functional teams and regional and market teams on individual store designs. Participates in schematic reviews with Operations and Design Reviews with Global Design. Participates in market tours to gain cross functional alignment in market priorities. Manages the architectural design process by assessing the scope of the project through review of surveys and deal documents. Responsible for the development of all schematic drawings and all store palettes in a market. Manages the production of construction documents by designers and consultants. Ensures all intended scope of work, needs and code requirements are met on drawings. Checks drawings for design intent. Conducts site visits as needed. Partner Development & Team Building - Providing partners with coaching, feedback, and developmental opportunities and building effective teams: Challenges and inspires partners to achieve business results. Conducts and ensures the completion of performance reviews. Ensures continued partner development and development of direct reports. Creates development plans. Provides coaching and conflict resolution. Ensures partners adhere to legal and operational compliance requirements. Oversees training and development of partners directly and indirectly managed and makes effective staffing decisions. Provides coaching, direction and leadership support to team members in order to achieve partner, business and customer results. We’d Love To Hear From People With Degree or diploma in the design discipline from a recognized educational institution. Demonstrated direct experience creating interior and architectural design concepts for a range of project sizes and varying complexity levels. Relevant experience leading design teams with decision-making authority and accountability, managing direct reports, budgets and coordinating external consultants. Interior and architectural design experience in retail, hospitality or restaurant design, working with design agencies and/or development organizations. (8 - 10 years) Join us and be part of something bigger. Now Brewing – Future Leaders! #tobeapartner Starbucks is known for developing extraordinary leaders who drive business success by doing the right thing for partners (employees), customers and communities – globally. As a Starbucks leader you are driven by a deep sense of purpose. You are aspirational - never a bystander. You take action to make a positive difference every day, and you inspire others to do the same. Our Store Managers bring the Starbucks experience to life by managing store operations, driving financial success, building great teams, and building a meeting place in their communities. Ability to work full time (the work regularly demands in excess of 40 hours per week) including variable hours including early mornings, evenings, weekends and/ or holidays. Now Brewing – Future Leaders! #tobeapartner Starbucks is known for developing extraordinary leaders who drive business success by doing the right thing for partners (employees), customers and communities – globally.
